This ability will not take effect if this Pokémon is Ground-type and thus immune to Electric moves.  Electric moves will ignore this Pokémon's Substitute.

This effect includes non-damaging moves, i.e. Thunder-Wave.
volt-absorb.effect_short: Absorbs Electric moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.
volt-absorb.name: Volt Absorb

water-absorb.description:
Restores HP if hit by a
Water-type move.
water-absorb.effect_long:
Whenever a Water-type move hits this Pokémon, it heals for 1/4 of its maximum HP, negating any other effect on it.

Water moves will ignore this Pokémon's Substitute.
water-absorb.effect_short: Absorbs Water moves, healing for 1/4 max HP.
water-absorb.name: Water Absorb

water-veil.description:
Prevents the Pokémon
from getting a burn.
water-veil.effect_long:
This Pokémon cannot be burned.

If a Pokémon is burned and acquires this ability, its burn is healed; this includes when regaining a lost ability upon leaving battle.
water-veil.name: Water Veil

weak-armor.description:
Physical attacks lower its Defense
stat and raise its Speed stat.
weak-armor.effect_long:
Whenever a physical move hits this Pokémon, its Speed rises one stage and its Defense falls one stage.

This ability triggers on every hit of a multiple-hit move.
weak-armor.effect_short: Raises Speed and lowers Defense by one stage each upon being hit by a physical move.
weak-armor.name: Weak Armor

white-smoke.description:
Prevents other Pokémon
from lowering its stats.
white-smoke.effect_long:
This Pokémon cannot have its stats lowered by other Pokémon.

This ability does not prevent any stat losses other than stat modifiers, such as the Speed cut from paralysis; nor self-inflicted stat drops, such as the Special Attack drop from Overheat; nor opponent-triggered stat boosts, such as the Attack boost from Swagger.  This Pokémon can still be passed negative stat modifiers through Guard-Swap, Heart-Swap, or Power-Swap.

This ability functions identically to Clear-Body in battle.

Overworld: If the lead Pokémon has this ability, the wild encounter rate is halved.
white-smoke.effect_short: Prevents stats from being lowered by other Pokémon.
white-smoke.name: White Smoke

wonder-guard.effect_long:
This Pokémon is immune to damaging moves that are not super effective against it.

Moves that inflict fixed damage, such as Night-Shade or Seismic-Toss, are considered super effective if their types are.  Damage not directly dealt by moves, such as damage from weather, a status ailment, or Spikes, is not prevented.

This ability cannot be copied with Role-Play or traded away with Skill-Swap, but it can be copied with Trace, disabled with Gastro-Acid, or changed with Worry-Seed.  This Pokémon can still use Role Play itself to lose this ability, but not Skill Swap.

If this Pokémon has a Substitute, this ability will block moves as usual and any moves not blocked will react to the Substitute as usual.
wonder-guard.effect_short: Protects against damaging moves that are not super effective.
wonder-guard.name: Wonder Guard

wonder-skin.description:
Makes status moves
more likely to miss.
wonder-skin.effect_long: Non-damaging moves have exactly 50% base accuracy against this Pokémon.
wonder-skin.effect_short: Lowers incoming non-damaging moves' base accuracy to exactly 50%.
wonder-skin.name: Wonder Skin

zen-mode.description:
Changes the Pokémon’s
shape when HP is half or less.
zen-mode.effect_long:
This Pokémon switches between Standard Mode and Zen Mode after each turn depending on its HP.  Below 50% of its maximum HP, it switches to Zen Mode, and at 50% or above, it switches to Standard Mode.

This Pokémon returns to Standard Mode upon leaving battle or losing this ability.  This ability has no effect if this Pokémon is not a Darmanitan.
zen-mode.effect_short: Changes Darmanitan's form after each turn depending on its HP: Zen Mode below 50% max HP, and Standard Mode otherwise.
zen-mode.name: Zen Mode

ability-capsule.description:
A capsule that allows a Pokémon with
two Abilities to switch between these
Abilities when it is used.
ability-capsule.name: Ability Capsule

ability-urge.description:
When used, it activates the
Ability of an ally Pokémon.
ability-urge.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Selects another friendly Pokémon at random.  If that Pokémon's ability is normally activated by some condition—i.e., is not continuous and passive—its effect is forcibly activated.

This item can only be obtained or used via the Wonder Launcher.
ability-urge.effect_short: Forcibly activates a friendly Pokémon's ability.
ability-urge.name: Ability Urge

abomasite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Abomasnow hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
abomasite.name: Abomasite

absolite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Absol hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
absolite.name: Absolite

absorb-bulb.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts Sp. Atk if hit with a Water-
type attack. It can only be used once.
absorb-bulb.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder takes Water-type damage from a move, its Special Attack rises by one stage and this item is consumed.
absorb-bulb.effect_short: Held: Raises the holder's Special Attack by one stage when it takes Water-type damage.
absorb-bulb.name: Absorb Bulb

acro-bike.description:
A folding bicycle that is capable
of stunts like jumps and wheelies.
acro-bike.effect_long: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Slower than the Mach-Bike.  Can perform various tricks, allowing the trainer to reach certain special areas.
acro-bike.effect_short: More maneuverable than the Mach Bike, and allows hopping along rails.
acro-bike.name: Acro Bike

adamant-orb.description:
A brightly gleaming orb to be held by
Dialga. It boosts the power of Dragon-​
and Steel-type moves when it is held.
adamant-orb.effect_long:
Held by Dialga
:   Holder's Dragon- and Steel-type moves have 1.2× their usual power.
adamant-orb.effect_short: Boosts the damage from Dialga's Dragon-type and Steel-type moves by 20%.
adamant-orb.name: Adamant Orb

adventure-rules.description:
This book contains all the points a new
Trainer needs to know on a journey.
It was handmade by a kind friend.
adventure-rules.name: Adventure Rules

aerodactylite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Aerodactyl hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
aerodactylite.name: Aerodactylite

aggronite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Aggron hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
aggronite.name: Aggronite

aguav-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, it restores the
user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause
confusion if the user hates the taste.
aguav-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes bitter flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Special Defense), it will also become confused.
aguav-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/2 max HP to restore 1/8 max HP. Confuses Pokémon that dislike bitter flavor.
aguav-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
aguav-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
aguav-berry.name: Aguav Berry

air-balloon.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
The holder will float in the air until hit.
Once hit, this item will burst.
air-balloon.effect_long:
Held
:   Holder is immune to Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic-Spikes, and Arena-Trap.

    This effect does not apply during Gravity or Ingrain.

    When the holder takes damage from a move, this item is consumed.
air-balloon.effect_short: Held: Grants immunity to Ground-type moves, Spikes, and Toxic Spikes. Consumed when the holder takes damage from a move.
air-balloon.name: Air Balloon

air-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of
colorful letter sets.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
air-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
air-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
air-mail.name: Air Mail

alakazite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Alakazam hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
alakazite.name: Alakazite

amaze-mulch.description:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
An amazing Mulch with the effects
of Rich, Surprise, and Boost Mulch.
amaze-mulch.name: Amaze Mulch

ampharosite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Ampharos hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
ampharosite.name: Ampharosite

amulet-coin.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It doubles any prize money received
if the holding Pokémon joins a battle.
amulet-coin.effect_long:
Held
:   If the holder participated in a trainer battle, the trainer earns twice the usual prize money.  This effect applies even if the holder fainted.

    This effect does not stack with any other similar effect.
amulet-coin.effect_short: Held: Doubles the money earned from a battle. Does not stack with Luck Incense.
amulet-coin.name: Amulet Coin

antidote.description:
A spray-type medicine for poisoning.
It can be used once to lift the effects
of being poisoned from a Pokémon.
antidote.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures poison.
antidote.name: Antidote

apicot-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Def
stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.
apicot-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Special Defense by one stage.
apicot-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost Special Defense.
apicot-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
apicot-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
apicot-berry.name: Apicot Berry

apricorn-box.description:
A handy box where you can store
up to 99 of each kind of Apricorn.
apricorn-box.name: Apricorn Box

armor-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived on the land. It looks to
be from some kind of protective collar.
armor-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in the Mining-Museum in Oreburgh-City or the Museum of Science in Pewter-City to receive a Shieldon.
armor-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into a Shieldon.
armor-fossil.name: Armor Fossil

aspear-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover
from being frozen on its own in battle.
aspear-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is frozen, it consumes this item to thaw itself.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures freezing.
aspear-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when frozen to cure frozen.
aspear-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
aspear-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
aspear-berry.name: Aspear Berry

assault-vest.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This offensive vest raises Sp. Def
but prevents the use of status moves.
assault-vest.name: Assault Vest

auroraticket.description:
A ticket required to board the ship
to BIRTH ISLAND.
It glows beautifully.
auroraticket.effect_long: Provides access to Birth Island and Deoxys.
auroraticket.effect_short: Allows access to Birth Island and Deoxys.
auroraticket.name: AuroraTicket

awakening.description:
A spray-type medicine used against
sleep. It can be used once to rouse a
Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.
awakening.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures sleep.
awakening.name: Awakening

azure-flute.description:
A flute that puts out echoing sounds
that do not seem to be of this world.
No one knows who made it.
azure-flute.effect_short: Allows entry into the Hall of Origin. Unreleased.
azure-flute.name: Azure Flute

babiri-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Steel-type attack.
babiri-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Steel-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
babiri-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Steel-type attack to halve the damage.
babiri-berry.name: Babiri Berry

balm-mushroom.description:
A rare mushroom that gives off
a nice fragrance. It can be sold at
a high price to shops.
balm-mushroom.effect_short: Sell to Hungry Maid for 25000 Pokédollars.
balm-mushroom.name: Balm Mushroom

banettite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Banette hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
banettite.name: Banettite

basement-key.description:
A key that opens a door in the
Goldenrod Tunnel.
basement-key.effect_long:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Opens the door to the basement tunnel under Goldenrod-City.
basement-key.effect_short: HS: Key to the tunnel under Goldenrod City. Gen III: Key to New Mauville.
basement-key.name: Basement Key

bead-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL to be held by a
POKéMON. It will bear the print of
the POKéMON holding it.
bead-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bead-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bead-mail.name: Bead Mail

belue-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
belue-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
belue-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
belue-berry.name: Belue Berry

berry-juice.description:
A 100 percent pure juice made of Berries.
When consumed, it restores
20 HP to an injured Pokémon.
berry-juice.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 20 HP.
berry-juice.name: Berry Juice

berry-pots.description:
Handy containers for cultivating
Berries wherever you go.
berry-pots.effect_long: Contains four portable pots of soil suitable for growing berries.
berry-pots.name: Berry Pots

berry-pouch.description:
A pouch for carrying BERRIES.
It is attached to the BAG’s
compartment for important items.
berry-pouch.name: Berry Pouch

bicycle.description:
A folding Bicycle that enables a rider
to get around much faster than a pair
of Running Shoes will allow.
bicycle.effect_long: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  In high gear, allows the trainer to hop over some rocks and ascend muddy slopes.
bicycle.name: Bicycle

big-mushroom.description:
A very large and rare mushroom.
It’s popular with a certain class of
collectors and sought out by them.
big-mushroom.effect_short: Fire Red and Leaf Green: Trade for prior Level-up moves. Sell for 2500 Pokédollars, or to Hungry Maid for 5000 Pokédollars.
big-mushroom.name: Big Mushroom

big-nugget.description:
A big nugget of pure gold that gives
off a lustrous gleam. It can be sold
at a high price to shops.
big-nugget.effect_short: Sell to Ore Collector for 30000 Pokédollars.
big-nugget.name: Big Nugget

big-pearl.description:
A rather large pearl that has a very nice silvery
sheen. It can be sold to shops for a high price.
big-pearl.effect_short: Sell for 3750 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 7500 Pokédollars.
big-pearl.name: Big Pearl

big-root.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts the power of HP-stealing
moves so the holder recovers more HP.
big-root.effect_long: Held: HP restored from Absorb, Aqua Ring, Drain Punch, Dream Eater, Giga Drain, Ingrain, Leech Life, Leech Seed, and Mega Drain is increased by 30%.  Damage inflicted is not affected.
big-root.effect_short: Held: Increases HP recovered from draining moves, Ingrain, and Aqua Ring by 3/10 (30%).
big-root.name: Big Root

bike-voucher.description:
Take this voucher to the BIKE SHOP
in CERULEAN CITY and exchange it
for a bicycle.
bike-voucher.effect_long: May be traded for a Bicycle.
bike-voucher.effect_short: Trade in Cerulean bike shop for a Bicycle.
bike-voucher.name: Bike Voucher

binding-band.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
A band that increases the power of
binding moves used by the holder.
binding-band.effect_long:
Held
:   Moves used by the holder that trap and damage a target for multiple turns (e.g. Bind, Fire-Spin) inflict twice their usual per-turn damage.
binding-band.effect_short: Held: Doubles the per-turn damage of multi-turn trapping moves.
binding-band.name: Binding Band

black-apricorn.description:
A black Apricorn.
It has a scent beyond one’s experience.
black-apricorn.effect_long: May be given to Kurt in Azalea-Town to produce a Heavy-Ball.
black-apricorn.effect_short: Used to make a Heavy Ball.
black-apricorn.name: Black Apricorn

black-belt.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This belt helps the wearer to focus and
boosts the power of Fighting-type moves.
black-belt.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Fighting moves by 20%.
black-belt.effect_short: Held: Fighting-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
black-belt.name: Black Belt

black-flute.description:
A lovely toy flute to admire.
It’s made from black glass.
black-flute.effect_long:
Used outside of battle
:   Decreases the wild Pokémon encounter rate by 50%.
black-flute.effect_short: Halves the wild Pokémon encounter rate.
black-flute.name: Black Flute

black-glasses.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
A pair of shady-looking glasses that
boost the power of Dark-type moves.
black-glasses.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Dark moves by 20%.
black-glasses.effect_short: Held: Dark-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
black-glasses.name: Black Glasses

black-sludge.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It gradually restores HP to Poison-type
Pokémon. It damages any other type.
black-sludge.effect_long: Held: If the holder is Poison-type, restores 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.  Otherwise, damages the holder by 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.
black-sludge.effect_short: Held: Poison-type holder recovers 1/16 (6.25%) max HP each turn. Non-Poison-Types take 1/8 (12.5%) max HP damage.
black-sludge.name: Black Sludge

blastoisinite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Blastoise hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
blastoisinite.name: Blastoisinite

blazikenite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Blaziken hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
blazikenite.name: Blazikenite

bloom-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of pretty
floral patterns.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
bloom-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bloom-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bloom-mail.name: Bloom Mail

blue-apricorn.description:
A blue Apricorn.
It smells a bit like grass.
blue-apricorn.effect_long: May be given to Kurt in Azalea-Town to produce a Lure-Ball.
blue-apricorn.effect_short: Used to make a Lure Ball.
blue-apricorn.name: Blue Apricorn

blue-card.description:
A card to save points for the
Buena’s Password show.
blue-card.effect_long: Allows the trainer to answer the daily question on Buena's radio show.  Records the points earned for correct answers.
blue-card.effect_short: Keeps track of points from Buena's show.
blue-card.name: Blue Card

blue-flute.description:
A lovely toy flute to admire.
It’s made from blue glass.
blue-flute.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures sleep.
blue-flute.name: Blue Flute

blue-orb.description:
A shiny blue orb that is said to have
a legend tied to it. It’s known to have a
deep connection with the Hoenn region.
blue-orb.effect_long: Causes Kyogre to appear in the Embedded-Tower.
blue-orb.effect_short: Summons Kyogre to the Embedded Tower.
blue-orb.name: Blue Orb

blue-scarf.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
During a Contest, it raises the Beauty
aspect of the Pokémon holding it.
blue-scarf.effect_long: Held: Increases the holder's Beauty during a Super Contest's Visual Competition.
blue-scarf.effect_short: Raises the holder's Beauty while in a contest.
blue-scarf.name: Blue Scarf

blue-shard.description:
A small blue shard. It appears
to be a fragment of some sort
of implement made long ago.
blue-shard.effect_long:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a Rain-Dance TM in the house midway along the southern section of Sinnoh-Route-212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on Sinnoh-Route-212, in Snowpoint-City, and in the Survival-Area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a Chesto-Berry, an Oran-Berry, and a Wiki-Berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in Violet-City.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a Bluk-Berry, a Cornn-Berry, and a Kelpsy-Berry with the Juggler near the Pal-Park entrance in Fuchsia-City.
blue-shard.effect_short: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.
blue-shard.name: Blue Shard

bluk-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
bluk-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
bluk-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
bluk-berry.name: Bluk Berry

boost-mulch.description:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
It increases the Berry harvest that
can be grown by diligent watering.
boost-mulch.name: Boost Mulch

brick-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of a
tough-looking brick pattern.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
brick-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
brick-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
brick-mail.name: Brick Mail

Stationery featuring an illustration of a bright-red
drawbridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bridge-mail-d.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bridge-mail-d.name: Bridge Mail D

Stationery featuring an illustration of

Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bridge-mail-m.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bridge-mail-m.name: Bridge Mail M

Stationery featuring an illustration of
a bridge that seems to pierce the sky.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
bridge-mail-s.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bridge-mail-s.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bridge-mail-s.name: Bridge Mail S

Stationery featuring an illustration of a
high-tension steel suspension bridge.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
bridge-mail-t.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bridge-mail-t.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bridge-mail-t.name: Bridge Mail T

Stationery featuring an illustration of
a vintage-looking brick bridge.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
bridge-mail-v.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bridge-mail-v.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bridge-mail-v.name: Bridge Mail V

bright-powder.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It casts a tricky glare that lowers
the opposing Pokémon’s accuracy.
bright-powder.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   Moves targeting the holder have 0.9× chance to hit.
bright-powder.effect_short: Held: Increases the holder's evasion by 1/9 (11 1/9%).
bright-powder.name: Bright Powder

bubble-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of a blue
world underwater.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
bubble-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
bubble-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
bubble-mail.name: Bubble Mail

bug-gem.description:
A gem with an insect-like essence.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Bug-type move one time.
bug-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Bug-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
bug-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Bug-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
bug-gem.name: Bug Gem

burn-drive.description:
A cassette to be held by Genesect.
It changes Genesect’s Techno Blast
move so it becomes Fire type.
burn-drive.effect_long:
Held by Genesect
:   Holder's buster is red, and its Techno-Blast is Fire-type.
burn-drive.effect_short: Grants Genesect a red, Fire-type Techno Blast.
burn-drive.name: Burn Drive

burn-heal.description:
A spray-type medicine for treating
burns. It can be used once to heal
a Pokémon suffering from a burn.
burn-heal.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures a burn.
burn-heal.name: Burn Heal

calcium.description:
A nutritious drink for Pokémon.
When consumed, it raises the base
Sp. Atk stat of a single Pokémon.
calcium.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Special Attack effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
calcium.effect_short: Raises Special Attack effort and happiness.
calcium.name: Calcium

carbos.description:
A nutritious drink for Pokémon.
When consumed, it raises the base
Speed stat of a single Pokémon.
carbos.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Speed effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
carbos.name: Carbos

card-key.description:
A card key that opens a shutter in the
Radio Tower.
card-key.effect_long:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Opens doors in the Goldenrod-City Radio Tower.
card-key.effect_short: HS: Opens doors in the Radio Tower. Gen III: Unlocks Silph Co Doors.
card-key.name: Card Key

casteliacone.description:
Castelia City’s specialty, soft-serve
ice cream. It heals all the status
problems of a single Pokémon.
casteliacone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment and confusion.
casteliacone.effect_short: Cures any status ailment and confusion.
casteliacone.name: Casteliacone

cell-battery.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts Attack if hit with an Electric-
type attack. It can only be used once.
cell-battery.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder takes Electric-type damage from a move, its Attack rises by one stage and this item is consumed.
cell-battery.effect_short: Held: Raises the holder's Attack by one stage when it takes Electric-type damage.
cell-battery.name: Cell Battery

charcoal.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a combustible fuel that boosts
the power of Fire-type moves.
charcoal.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Fire moves by 20%.
charcoal.effect_short: Held: Fire-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
charcoal.name: Charcoal

charizardite-x.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Charizard hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
charizardite-x.name: Charizardite X

charizardite-y.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Charizard hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
charizardite-y.name: Charizardite Y

charti-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Rock-type attack.
charti-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Rock-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
charti-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Rock-type attack to halve the damage.
charti-berry.name: Charti Berry

cheri-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover
from paralysis on its own in battle.
cheri-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is paralyzed, it consumes this item to cure the paralysis.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures paralysis.
cheri-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when paralyzed to cure paralysis.
cheri-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
cheri-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
cheri-berry.name: Cheri Berry

cherish-ball.description:
A quite rare Poké Ball that has been
crafted in order to commemorate
a special occasion of some sort.
cherish-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
cherish-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.
cherish-ball.name: Cherish Ball

chesto-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover
from sleep on its own in battle.
chesto-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is asleep, it consumes this item to wake up.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures sleep.
chesto-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when asleep to cure sleep.
chesto-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
chesto-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
chesto-berry.name: Chesto Berry

chilan-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry
will lessen the damage taken
from one Normal-type attack.
chilan-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take Normal-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
chilan-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a Normal-type attack to halve the damage.
chilan-berry.name: Chilan Berry

chill-drive.description:
A cassette to be held by Genesect.
It changes Genesect’s Techno Blast
move so it becomes Ice type.
chill-drive.effect_long:
Held by Genesect
:   Holder's buster is white, and its Techno-Blast becomes Ice-type.
chill-drive.effect_short: Grants Genesect a white, Ice-type Techno Blast.
chill-drive.name: Chill Drive

choice-band.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This curious headband boosts Attack
but only allows the use of one move.
choice-band.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   Holder has 1.5× its Attack.  When the holder attempts to use a move, all its other moves are disabled until it leaves battle or loses this item.

    The restriction ends even if this item is swapped for another Choice item
via Trick or Switcheroo.
choice-band.effect_short: Held: Increases Attack by 50%, but restricts the holder to only one move.
choice-band.name: Choice Band

choice-scarf.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This curious scarf boosts Speed
but only allows the use of one move.
choice-scarf.effect_long:
Held: Increases the holder's Speed by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)
choice-scarf.effect_short: Held: Increases Speed by 50%, but restricts the holder to only one move.
choice-scarf.name: Choice Scarf

choice-specs.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
These curious glasses boost Sp. Atk
but only allow the use of one move.
choice-specs.effect_long:
Held: Increases the holder's Special Attack by 50%, but restricts it to the first move it uses until it leaves battle or loses this item.  If this item is swapped for another Choice item via Trick or Switcheroo, the holder's restriction is still lifted, but it will again be restricted to the next move it uses.
(Quirk: If the holder is switched in by U-Turn and it also knows U-Turn, U-Turn becomes its restricted move.)
choice-specs.effect_short: Held: Increases Special Attack by 50%, but restricts the holder to only one move.
choice-specs.name: Choice Specs

chople-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Fighting-type attack.
chople-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Fighting-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
chople-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Fighting-type attack to halve the damage.
chople-berry.name: Chople Berry

claw-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived in the sea. It appears
to be a fragment of a claw.
claw-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in the Mining-Museum in Oreburgh-City or the Museum of Science in Pewter-City to receive a Anorith.
claw-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into an Anorith.
claw-fossil.name: Claw Fossil

cleanse-tag.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It helps keep wild Pokémon away if
the holder is the head of the party.
cleanse-tag.effect_long: Held by lead Pokémon: Prevents wild battles with Pokémon that are lower level than the holder.
cleanse-tag.effect_short: Prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.
cleanse-tag.name: Cleanse Tag

clear-bell.description:
A very old-fashioned bell that
makes a gentle ringing sound.
clear-bell.effect_long: May be given to the Kimono Girls to summon Ho-Oh to the top of the Bell-Tower.
clear-bell.effect_short: HS: Allows Kimono-girls to summon Ho-oh. C: Summons Suicune to the Tin Tower.
clear-bell.name: Clear Bell

clever-wing.description:
An item for use on a Pokémon.
It slightly increases the base Sp. Def
stat of a single Pokémon.
clever-wing.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Special Defense effort by 1.
clever-wing.name: Clever Wing

coba-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Flying-type attack.
coba-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Flying-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
coba-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Flying-type attack to halve the damage.
coba-berry.name: Coba Berry

coin-case.description:
A case for holding coins obtained
at the Game Corner. It can hold up
to 50,000 coins.
coin-case.effect_long: Contains the Coins used by the Game Corner, to a maximum of 50,000.
coin-case.effect_short: Holds coins for the Game Corner.
coin-case.name: Coin Case

colbur-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Dark-type attack.
colbur-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Dark-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
colbur-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Dark-type attack to halve the damage.
colbur-berry.name: Colbur Berry

colress-machine.description:
A special device that wrings out
the potential of Pokémon.
It is an imperfect prototype.
colress-machine.effect_short: Wakes up the Crustle blocking the way in Seaside Cave.
colress-machine.name: Colress Machine

comet-shard.description:
A shard that fell to the ground
when a comet approached. It can
be sold at a high price to shops.
comet-shard.effect_short: Sell to Ore Collector for 60000 Pokédollars.
comet-shard.name: Comet Shard

contest-pass.description:
A pass required for entering Pokémon
Contests. It has a drawing of an award
ribbon on its front.
contest-pass.effect_long: Allows the trainer to enter Contests.
contest-pass.name: Contest Pass

cornn-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
cornn-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
cornn-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
cornn-berry.name: Cornn Berry

coupon-1.description:
A coupon to be exchanged for a
Pokémon Watch--Pokétch for short.
Three coupons are needed.
coupon-1.effect_long: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.
coupon-1.effect_short: The first of three tickets used to obtain a Pokétch.
coupon-1.name: Coupon 1

coupon-2.description:
A coupon to be exchanged for a
Pokémon Watch--Pokétch for short.
Three coupons are needed.
coupon-2.effect_long: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.
coupon-2.effect_short: The second of three tickets used to obtain a Pokétch.
coupon-2.name: Coupon 2

coupon-3.description:
A coupon to be exchanged for a
Pokémon Watch--Pokétch for short.
Three coupons are needed.
coupon-3.effect_long: One of three coupons needed to receive a Pokétch.
coupon-3.effect_short: The last of three tickets used to obtain a Pokétch.
coupon-3.name: Coupon 3

cover-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived in the sea. It appears
as though it could be part of its back.
cover-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in a museum to receive a Tirtouga.
cover-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into a Tirtouga.
cover-fossil.name: Cover Fossil

custap-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it will be able to
move first just once when it’s in a pinch.
custap-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item.  On the following turn, the holder will act first among moves with the same priority, regardless of Speed.
custap-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP when using a move to go first.
custap-berry.name: Custap Berry

damp-mulch.description:
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil
in regions where Berries are grown.
damp-mulch.effect_long:
Used on a patch of soil
:   Plant's growth stages will each last 25% more time.  Dries soil out more slowly.
damp-mulch.effect_short: Growing time of berries is increased, but the soil dries out slower.
damp-mulch.name: Damp Mulch

damp-rock.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It extends the duration of the move
Rain Dance when used by the holder.
damp-rock.effect_long: Held: The holder's Rain Dance will create rain lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.
damp-rock.effect_short: Held: Rain Dance by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.
damp-rock.name: Damp Rock

dark-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of darkness.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Dark-type move one time.
dark-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Dark-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
dark-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Dark-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
dark-gem.name: Dark Gem

dark-stone.description:
Zekrom’s body was destroyed and
changed into this stone. It is said to
be waiting for the emergence of a hero.
dark-stone.effect_long: Summons Zekrom for the final battle against N.
dark-stone.effect_short: Summons Zekrom for the final battle against N.
dark-stone.name: Dark Stone

data-card-01.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many victories
you have had in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-01.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-01.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-01.name: Data Card 01

data-card-02.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many losses
you have had in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-02.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-02.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-02.name: Data Card 02

data-card-03.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times your
Pokémon dashed in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-03.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have dashed in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-03.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have dashed in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-03.name: Data Card 03

data-card-04.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times your
Pokémon jumped in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-04.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have jumped in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-04.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have jumped in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-04.name: Data Card 04

data-card-05.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Hurdle Dash.
data-card-05.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Hurdle Dash.
data-card-05.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Hurdle Dash.
data-card-05.name: Data Card 05

data-card-06.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Relay Run.
data-card-06.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Relay Run.
data-card-06.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Relay Run.
data-card-06.name: Data Card 06

data-card-07.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Pennant Capture.
data-card-07.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Pennant Capture.
data-card-07.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Pennant Capture.
data-card-07.name: Data Card 07

It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Block Smash.
data-card-08.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Block Smash.
data-card-08.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Block Smash.
data-card-08.name: Data Card 08

It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Disc Catch.
data-card-09.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Disc Catch.
data-card-09.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Disc Catch.
data-card-09.name: Data Card 09

It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Snow Throw.
data-card-10.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Snow Throw.
data-card-10.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Snow Throw.
data-card-10.name: Data Card 10

data-card-11.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many points your
Pokémon scored in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-11.effect_long: Records the number of points the trainer has earned in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-11.effect_short: Records the number of points the trainer has earned in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-11.name: Data Card 11

data-card-12.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times your
Pokémon failed in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-12.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have messed up in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-12.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have messed up in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-12.name: Data Card 12

data-card-13.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times
your Pokémon impeded themselves.
data-card-13.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have defeated themselves in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-13.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have defeated themselves in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-13.name: Data Card 13

data-card-14.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times your
Pokémon tackled in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-14.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have tackled in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-14.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have tackled in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-14.name: Data Card 14

data-card-15.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times your
Pokémon fell down in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-15.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have fallen in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-15.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon have fallen in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-15.name: Data Card 15

data-card-16.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Ring Drop.
data-card-16.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Ring Drop.
data-card-16.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Ring Drop.
data-card-16.name: Data Card 16

data-card-17.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Lamp Jump.
data-card-17.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Lamp Jump.
data-card-17.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Lamp Jump.
data-card-17.name: Data Card 17

data-card-18.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Circle Push.
data-card-18.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Circle Push.
data-card-18.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Circle Push.
data-card-18.name: Data Card 18

data-card-19.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many Link
Pokéathlon wins you have had.
data-card-19.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon over wirelss.
data-card-19.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first place overall in the Pokéathlon over wirelss.
data-card-19.name: Data Card 19

data-card-20.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many Link
Pokéathlon losses you have had.
data-card-20.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon over wireless.
data-card-20.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last place overall in the Pokéathlon over wireless.
data-card-20.name: Data Card 20

data-card-21.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times
you have won a Pokéathlon event.
data-card-21.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first across all Pokéathlon events.
data-card-21.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first across all Pokéathlon events.
data-card-21.name: Data Card 21

data-card-22.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times
you have lost a Pokéathlon event.
data-card-22.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last across all Pokéathlon events.
data-card-22.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in last across all Pokéathlon events.
data-card-22.name: Data Card 22

data-card-23.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
switched Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-23.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has switched Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-23.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has switched Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-23.name: Data Card 23

data-card-24.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
won the Pokéathlon’s Goal Roll.
data-card-24.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Goal Roll.
data-card-24.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has come in first in the Pokéathlon Goal Roll.
data-card-24.name: Data Card 24

data-card-25.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times your
Pokémon won individual prizes.
data-card-25.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon received prizes in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-25.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer's Pokémon received prizes in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-25.name: Data Card 25

data-card-26.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how many times you
instructed your Pokémon.
data-card-26.effect_long: Records the number of times the trainer has instructed Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-26.effect_short: Records the number of times the trainer has instructed Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-26.name: Data Card 26

data-card-27.description:
It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a
card that shows how much time you
spent participating in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-27.effect_long: Records the total time spent in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-27.effect_short: Records the total time spent in the Pokéathlon.
data-card-27.name: Data Card 27

dawn-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It sparkles like a glittering eye.
dawn-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a male Kirlia into Gallade or a female Snorunt into Froslass.
dawn-stone.effect_short: Evolves a male Kirlia into Gallade or a female Snorunt into Froslass.
dawn-stone.name: Dawn Stone

deep-sea-scale.description:
An item to be held by Clamperl.
This scale shines with a faint pink and
raises the holder’s Sp. Def stat.
deep-sea-scale.effect_long: Held by Clamperl: Doubles the holder's Special Defense.  Evolves the holder into Gorebyss when traded.
deep-sea-scale.effect_short: Doubles Clamperl's Special Defense. Traded on a Clamperl: Holder evolves into Gorebyss.
deep-sea-scale.name: Deep Sea Scale

deep-sea-tooth.description:
An item to be held by Clamperl.
This fang gleams a sharp silver and
raises the holder’s Sp. Atk stat.
deep-sea-tooth.effect_long: Held by Clamperl: Doubles the holder's Special Attack.  Evolves the holder into Huntail when traded.
deep-sea-tooth.effect_short: Doubles Clamperl's Special Attack. Traded on a Clamperl: Holder evolves into Huntail.
deep-sea-tooth.name: Deep Sea Tooth

destiny-knot.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
If the holder becomes infatuated,
the opposing Pokémon will be, too.
destiny-knot.effect_long: Held: When the holder becomes Attracted, the Pokémon it is Attracted to becomes Attracted back.
destiny-knot.effect_short: Held: Infatuates opposing Pokémon when holder is inflicted with infatuation.
destiny-knot.name: Destiny Knot

devon-goods.description:
A package that contains mechanical
parts of some sort made by the
DEVON CORPORATION.
devon-goods.effect_long: Contains a machine part to be delivered to Captain Stern.
devon-goods.effect_short: Contains mechanical parts to be delivered to Captain Stern.
devon-goods.name: Devon Goods

devon-scope.description:
A scope that signals the presence
of any unseeable POKéMON.
It is made by the DEVON CORP.
devon-scope.effect_long: Reveals invisble Kecleon on the overworld.
devon-scope.name: Devon Scope

dire-hit.description:
An item that raises the critical-hit ratio
greatly. It can be used only once and
wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.
dire-hit.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Increases the target's critical hit chance by one stage until it leaves the field.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.
dire-hit.effect_short: Increases the chance of a critical hit in battle.  Raises happiness.
dire-hit.name: Dire Hit

dire-hit-2.description:
It can be used many times to raise the
critical-hit ratio of one Pokémon. It
wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.
dire-hit-2.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Raises the target's critical hit rate by two stages.
This item can only be obtained or used via the Wonder Launcher.
dire-hit-2.effect_short: Raises critical hit rate by two stages in battle.  Wonder Launcher only.
dire-hit-2.name: Dire Hit 2

dire-hit-3.description:
It can be used many times to greatly
raise a Pokémon’s critical-hit ratio. It
wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.
dire-hit-3.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Raises the target's critical hit rate by three stages.
This item can only be obtained or used via the Wonder Launcher.
dire-hit-3.effect_short: Raises critical hit rate by three stages in battle.  Wonder Launcher only.
dire-hit-3.name: Dire Hit 3

discount-coupon.description:
This special coupon allows you to
buy items at a discount when you
are shopping at a boutique.
discount-coupon.name: Discount Coupon

dive-ball.description:
A somewhat different Poké Ball that
works especially well when catching
Pokémon that live underwater.
dive-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon was encountered by surfing or fishing, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
dive-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate is 3.5× when underwater, fishing, or surfing.
dive-ball.name: Dive Ball

dna-splicers.description:
A splicer that fuses Kyurem and a
certain Pokémon. They are said to
have been one in the beginning.
dna-splicers.effect_short: Fuses Kyurem with Reshiram or Zekrom, or splits them apart again.
dna-splicers.name: DNA Splicers

dome-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived in the sea. It could
be a shell or carapace.
dome-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in the Mining-Museum in Oreburgh-City or the Museum of Science in Pewter-City to receive a Kabuto.
dome-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into a Kabuto.
dome-fossil.name: Dome Fossil

douse-drive.description:
A cassette to be held by Genesect.
It changes Genesect’s Techno Blast
move so it becomes Water type.
douse-drive.effect_long:
Held by Genesect
:   Holder's buster is blue, and its Techno-Blast is Water-type.
douse-drive.effect_short: Grants Genesect a blue, Water-type Techno Blast.
douse-drive.name: Douse Drive

dowsing-machine.description:
It searches for hidden items in the
area and emits different lights and
sounds when it detects something.
dowsing-machine.effect_long:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Searches for hidden items.
dowsing-machine.effect_short: Use to find hidden items on the field. AKA Itemfinder.
dowsing-machine.name: Dowsing Machine

draco-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Dragon-type moves.
draco-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Dragon moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Dragon.
draco-plate.effect_short: Held: Dragon-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Dragon.
draco-plate.name: Draco Plate

dragon-fang.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This hard and sharp fang boosts
the power of Dragon-type moves.
dragon-fang.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Dragon moves by 20%.
dragon-fang.effect_short: Held: Dragon-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
dragon-fang.name: Dragon Fang

dragon-gem.description:
A gem with a draconic essence.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Dragon-type move one time.
dragon-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Dragon-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
dragon-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Dragon-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
dragon-gem.name: Dragon Gem

dragon-scale.description:
A very tough and inflexible scale.
Dragon-type Pokémon may be
holding this item when caught.
dragon-scale.effect_long: Held by Seadra: Evolves the holder into Kingdra when traded.
dragon-scale.effect_short: Traded on a Seadra: Holder evolves into Kingdra.
dragon-scale.name: Dragon Scale

dragon-skull.description:
A skull of a Pokémon which was said
to have braved the angry waters to
fly around the world.
dragon-skull.effect_long: Only used as a plot point; this item is given to the player and taken away in the same cutscene.
dragon-skull.effect_short: Return to the museum in Nacrene City.
dragon-skull.name: Dragon Skull

dread-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Dark-type moves.
dread-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Dark moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Dark.
dread-plate.effect_short: Held: Dark-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Dark.
dread-plate.name: Dread Plate

dream-ball.description:
A special Poké Ball that appears in your
Bag out of nowhere in the Entree Forest.
It can catch any Pokémon.
dream-ball.effect_long:
Can only be used in Entree Forest, to catch Pokémon encountered in the Dream World.

Used in battle
:   Catches a wild Pokémon without fail.
dream-ball.effect_short: Catches Pokémon found in the Dream World.
dream-ball.name: Dream Ball

dream-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL to be held by a
POKéMON. It will bear the print of
the POKéMON holding it.
dream-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
dream-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
dream-mail.name: Dream Mail

dropped-item.description:
The Xtransceiver found at the
Nimbasa City amusement park.
It seems it belongs to a boy.
dropped-item.effect_short: Returned to Curtis or Yancy as part of a sidequest.
dropped-item.name: Dropped Item

dubious-disc.description:
A transparent device
overflowing with dubious data.
Its producer is unknown.
dubious-disc.effect_long: Held by Porygon2: Evolves the holder into Porygon-Z when traded.
dubious-disc.effect_short: Traded on a Porygon2: Holder evolves into Porygon-Z.
dubious-disc.name: Dubious Disc

durin-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
durin-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
durin-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
durin-berry.name: Durin Berry

dusk-ball.description:
A somewhat different Poké Ball that
makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon
at night or in dark places like caves.
dusk-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If it's currently nighttime or the wild Pokémon was encountered while walking in a cave, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
dusk-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3.5× at night and in caves.
dusk-ball.name: Dusk Ball

dusk-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It holds shadows as dark as can be.
dusk-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a Lampent into Chandelure, a Misdreavus into Mismagius, or a Murkrow into Honchkrow.
dusk-stone.effect_short: Evolves a Lampent into Chandelure, a Misdreavus into Mismagius, or a Murkrow into Honchkrow.
dusk-stone.name: Dusk Stone

earth-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Ground-type moves.
earth-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ground moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Ground.
earth-plate.effect_short: Held: Ground-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Ground.
earth-plate.name: Earth Plate

eject-button.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
If the holder is hit by an attack, it
will be switched out of battle.
eject-button.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder takes damage directly from a move and does not faint, it switches out for another non-fainted Pokémon in its party, as chosen by the Trainer.
This effect does not activate if another effect prevents the holder from switching out.
eject-button.effect_short: Held: When the holder takes damage from a move, it switches out for a party Pokémon of the Trainer's choice.
eject-button.name: Eject Button

electirizer.description:
A box packed with a tremendous
amount of electric energy.
It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.
electirizer.effect_long: Held by Electabuzz: Evolves the holder into Electivire when traded.
electirizer.effect_short: Traded on an Electabuzz: Holder evolves into Electivire.
electirizer.name: Electirizer

electric-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of electricity.
When held, it strengthens the power of
an Electric-type move one time.
electric-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Electric-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
electric-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Electric-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
electric-gem.name: Electric Gem

elevator-key.description:
A card key that activates the elevator
in Lysandre Labs.
It is emblazoned with Team Flare’s logo.
elevator-key.name: Elevator Key

elixir.description:
This medicine can restore 10 PP
to each of the moves that have
been learned by a Pokémon.
elixir.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 PP for each move.
elixir.name: Elixir

energy-powder.description:
A bitter medicine powder.
When consumed, it restores
50 HP to an injured Pokémon.
energy-powder.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 50 HP.  Decreases happiness by 5/5/10.
energy-powder.name: Energy Powder

energy-root.description:
An extremely bitter medicinal root.
When consumed, it restores
200 HP to an injured Pokémon.
energy-root.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 200 HP.  Decreases happiness by 10/10/15.
energy-root.name: Energy Root

enigma-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, being hit by a
supereffective attack will restore its HP.
enigma-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder takes super-effective damage, it consumes this item to restore 1/4 its max HP.
enigma-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective attack to restore 1/4 max HP.
enigma-berry.name: Enigma Berry

enigma-stone.description:
A crystal ball that was excavated from
the ground. It’s a very beautiful stone that
is covered with bits of rock and earth.
enigma-stone.effect_long:
When taken to the Pewter-City museum, causes Latias or Latios to attack the trainer.

The Pokémon to appear will be whicher can't be encountered roaming in the wild.
enigma-stone.effect_short: S: Summons Latias H: Summons Latios.
enigma-stone.name: Enigma Stone

eon-ticket.description:
The ticket required for sailing on a
ferry to a distant southern island.
It features a drawing of an island.
eon-ticket.effect_long: Provides access to Southern-Island and either Latias or Latios, whichever is not available roaming around Hoenn.
eon-ticket.effect_short: Provides access to Southern Island and Latias or Latios.
eon-ticket.name: Eon Ticket

escape-rope.description:
A long and durable rope.
Use it to escape instantly
from a cave or a dungeon.
escape-rope.effect_long:
Used outside of battle
:   Transports the trainer to the last-entered dungeon entrance.  Cannot be used outside, in buildings, or in Distortion-World, Sinnoh-Hall-Of-Origin-1, Spear-Pillar, or Turnback-Cave.
escape-rope.effect_short: Transports user to the outside entrance of a cave.
escape-rope.name: Escape Rope

ether.description:
This medicine can restore 10 PP
to a single selected move that
has been learned by a Pokémon.
ether.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 PP for a selected move.
ether.name: Ether

everstone.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
A Pokémon holding this peculiar
stone is prevented from evolving.
everstone.effect_long: Held: Prevents the holder from evolving naturally.  Evolution initiated by the trainer (Stones, etc) will still work.
everstone.effect_short: Held: Prevents level-based evolution from occuring.
everstone.name: Everstone

eviolite.description:
A mysterious Evolutionary lump. When
held by a Pokémon that can still evolve,
it raises both Defense and Sp. Def.
eviolite.effect_long:
Held by a Pokémon that is not fully evolved
:   Holder has 1.5× Defense and Special Defense.
eviolite.effect_short: Held: Holder has 1.5× Defense and Special Defense, as long as it's not fully evolved.
eviolite.name: Eviolite

exp-share.description:
Turning on this special device will
allow all the Pokémon on your team
to receive Exp. Points from battles.
exp-share.effect_long:
Held
:   Experience is split across two groups: Pokémon who participated in battle, and Pokémon holding this item.  Each Pokémon earns experience as though it had battled alone, divided by the number of Pokémon in its group, then divided by the number of groups. Pokémon holding this item who also participated in battle effectively earn experience twice.

    Fainted Pokémon never earn experience, and empty groups are
ignored; thus, if a single Pokémon is holding this item and the only Pokémon who battled faints from Explosion, the holder will gain full experience.
exp-share.effect_short: Held: Half the experience from a battle is split between Pokémon holding this item.
exp-share.name: Exp. Share

expert-belt.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a well-worn belt that slightly boosts
the power of supereffective moves.
expert-belt.effect_long: Held: When the holder hits with a super-effective move, its power is raised by 20%.
expert-belt.effect_short: Held: Holder's Super Effective moves do 20% extra damage.
expert-belt.name: Expert Belt

explorer-kit.description:
A bag filled with convenient tools for
exploring. It provides access to the
Underground in the Sinnoh region.
explorer-kit.effect_long: Sends the trainer to the Underground.  Only usable outside.
explorer-kit.name: Explorer Kit

fab-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL featuring a
gorgeous, extravagant print.
It is to be held by a POKéMON.
fab-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
fab-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
fab-mail.name: Fab Mail

fairy-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of the fey.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Fairy-type move one time.
fairy-gem.name: Fairy Gem

fame-checker.description:
A device that enables you to
recall what you’ve heard and seen
about famous people.
fame-checker.effect_long: Records information on various famous people.
fame-checker.name: Fame Checker

fashion-case.description:
A lovely case to store colorful Props
for your Pokémon to wear in a musical.
fashion-case.effect_short: Holds Pokémon Accessories for use in Contests.
fashion-case.name: Fashion Case

fast-ball.description:
A Poké Ball that makes it easier to
catch Pokémon that are usually
very quick to run away.
fast-ball.effect_long:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

:   If the wild Pokémon's base speed is 100 or more, its catch rate is 4× normal.
fast-ball.effect_short: 4× effectiveness on Pokémon with 100 or greater base speed. (Gen II: Roaming or Fleeing Pokémon). Made from Wht Apricorn.
fast-ball.name: Fast Ball

favored-mail.description:
Stationery designed to make it easier
to write about your favorite things.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
favored-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
favored-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
favored-mail.name: Favored Mail

fighting-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of combat.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Fighting-type move one time.
fighting-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Fighting-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
fighting-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Fighting-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
fighting-gem.name: Fighting Gem

figy-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, it restores the
user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause
confusion if the user hates the taste.
figy-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes spicy flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Attack), it will also become confused.
figy-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/2 max HP to restore 1/8 max HP. Confuses Pokémon that dislike spicy flavor.
figy-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
figy-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
figy-berry.name: Figy Berry

fire-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of fire.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Fire-type move one time.
fire-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Fire-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
fire-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Fire-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
fire-gem.name: Fire Gem

fire-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
The stone has a fiery orange heart.
fire-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an Eevee into Flareon, a Growlithe into Arcanine, a Pansear into Simisear, or a Vulpix into Ninetales.
fire-stone.effect_short: Evolves an Eevee into Flareon, a Growlithe into Arcanine, a Pansear into Simisear, or a Vulpix into Ninetales.
fire-stone.name: Fire Stone

fist-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Fighting-type moves.
fist-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Fighting moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Fighting.
fist-plate.effect_short: Held: Fighting-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Fighting.
fist-plate.name: Fist Plate

flame-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of flames
in blazing red.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
flame-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
flame-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
flame-mail.name: Flame Mail

flame-orb.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a bizarre orb that will afflict the
holder with a burn during battle.
flame-orb.effect_long: Held: Burns the holder at the end of each turn.
flame-orb.effect_short: Held: Inflicts Burn on the holder at the end of the turn. Activates after Burn damage would occur.
flame-orb.name: Flame Orb

flame-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Fire-type moves.
flame-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Fire moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Fire.
flame-plate.effect_short: Held: Fire-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Fire.
flame-plate.name: Flame Plate

float-stone.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This very light stone reduces the
weight of a Pokémon when held.
float-stone.name: Float Stone

fluffy-tail.description:
A toy that attracts the attention of a
Pokémon. It guarantees escape from
any battle with wild Pokémon.
fluffy-tail.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Ends a wild battle.  Cannot be used in trainer battles.
fluffy-tail.name: Fluffy Tail

flying-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of air.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Flying-type move one time.
flying-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Flying-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
flying-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Flying-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
flying-gem.name: Flying Gem

focus-band.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
The holder may endure a potential
KO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.
focus-band.effect_long: Held: If the holder is attacked for regular damage that would faint it, this item has a 10% chance to prevent the holder's HP from lowering below 1.
focus-band.effect_short: Held: Holder has 10% chance to survive attacks or self-inflicted damage at 1 HP.
focus-band.name: Focus Band

focus-sash.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder
has full HP, it will endure a potential KO
attack with 1 HP. The item then disappears.
focus-sash.effect_long: Held: If the holder has full HP and is attacked for regular damage that would faint it, this item is consumed and prevents the holder's HP from lowering below 1.  This effect works against multi-hit attacks, but does not work against the effects of Doom Desire or Future Sight.
focus-sash.effect_short: Held: Holder survives any single-hit attack at 1 HP if at max HP, then the item is consumed.
focus-sash.name: Focus Sash

fresh-water.description:
Water with a high mineral content.
When consumed, it restores
50 HP to an injured Pokémon.
fresh-water.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 50 HP.
fresh-water.name: Fresh Water

friend-ball.description:
A strange Poké Ball that will make
the wild Pokémon caught with it more
friendly toward you immediately.
friend-ball.effect_long:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If caught, the wild Pokémon's happiness starts at 200.
friend-ball.effect_short: Caught Pokémon start with 200 happiness. Made from Grn Apricorn.
friend-ball.name: Friend Ball

full-heal.description:
