A spray-type medicine that is broadly
effective. It can be used once to heal
all the status conditions of a Pokémon.
full-heal.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment and confusion.
full-heal.effect_short: Cures any status ailment and confusion.
full-heal.name: Full Heal

full-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This exotic-smelling incense makes
the holder bloated and slow moving.
full-incense.effect_long: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.
full-incense.effect_short: Held: Holder moves last in its priority bracket. Breeding: Snorlax begets a Munchlax Egg.
full-incense.name: Full Incense

full-restore.description:
A medicine that can be used to fully
restore the HP of a single Pokémon
and heal any status conditions it has.
full-restore.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores HP to full and cures any status ailment and confusion.
full-restore.effect_short: Restores HP to full and cures any status ailment and confusion.
full-restore.name: Full Restore

galactic-key.description:
A card key for disengaging the security
systems in the Galactic HQ. Losing it
can result in punishment, apparently.
galactic-key.effect_long: Grants access to Galactic HQ in Veilstone City.
galactic-key.effect_short: Grants access to Galactic HQ in Veilstone City.
galactic-key.name: Galactic Key

ganlon-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, its Defense
stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.
ganlon-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Defense by one stage.
ganlon-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost Defense.
ganlon-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
ganlon-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
ganlon-berry.name: Ganlon Berry

garchompite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Garchomp hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
garchompite.name: Garchompite

gardevoirite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Gardevoir hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
gardevoirite.name: Gardevoirite

gb-sounds.description:
A music player that allows you to listen
to nostalgic songs. It’s operated with
the flip of a single switch.
gb-sounds.effect_long:
Used by trainer outside of battle
:   Changes the background music to the equivalent 8-bit music.
gb-sounds.effect_short: Use to listen to GameBoy era audio.
gb-sounds.name: GB Sounds

gengarite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Gengar hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
gengarite.name: Gengarite

genius-wing.description:
An item for use on a Pokémon.
It slightly increases the base Sp. Atk
stat of a single Pokémon.
genius-wing.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Special Attack effort by 1.
genius-wing.name: Genius Wing

ghost-gem.description:
A gem with a spectral essence.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Ghost-type move one time.
ghost-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Ghost-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
ghost-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Ghost-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
ghost-gem.name: Ghost Gem

glitter-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL featuring a cute
PIKACHU print.
It is to be held by a POKéMON.
glitter-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
glitter-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
glitter-mail.name: Glitter Mail

go-goggles.description:
A pair of protective goggles.
They enable a TRAINER to travel
through even desert sandstorms.
go-goggles.effect_long: Allows the trainer to enter the desert on Hoenn-Route-111.
go-goggles.name: Go-Goggles

gold-teeth.description:
A set of false teeth lost by the
SAFARI ZONE’S WARDEN. It makes his
smile sparkle.
gold-teeth.effect_long: The Safari Zone warden's teeth, to be returned to him for Hm04.
gold-teeth.effect_short: The Safari Zone Warden's dentures. Trade for HM04 (Strength).
gold-teeth.name: Gold Teeth

good-rod.description:
A new, good-quality fishing rod.
Use it at any body of water to
fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.
good-rod.effect_long: Used to find Pokémon on the Good Rod list for an area, which are generally mediocre.
good-rod.effect_short: Used to catch Pokémon in bodies of water.
good-rod.name: Good Rod

gooey-mulch.description:
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil
in regions where Berries are grown.
gooey-mulch.effect_long:
Used on a path of soil
:   Plant will regrow after dying 25% more times.
gooey-mulch.effect_short: Berries regrow from dead plants an increased number of times.
gooey-mulch.name: Gooey Mulch

gracidea.description:
A flower sometimes bundled in
bouquets to convey gratitude on
special occasions like birthdays.
gracidea.effect_long:
Used by trainer on a Shaymin
:   Changes the target Shaymin from Land Forme to Sky Forme.

    This item cannot be used on a frozen Shaymin or at night.  Sky Forme Shaymin will revert to Land Forme overnight, when frozen, and upon entering a link battle.  This item must be used again to change it back.
gracidea.effect_short: Changes an unfrozen Shaymin to Sky Forme in the day.
gracidea.name: Gracidea

gram-1.description:
An important letter that
Wingull delivers.
gram-1.effect_long: Give to the Wingull on Unova-Route-13, along with Gram-2 and Gram-3, to receive Tm89.
gram-1.effect_short: Part of a sidequest to obtain Tm89.
gram-1.name: Gram 1

gram-2.description:
An important letter that
Wingull delivers.
gram-2.effect_long: Give to the Wingull on Unova-Route-13, along with Gram-1 and Gram-3, to receive Tm89.
gram-2.effect_short: Part of a sidequest to obtain Tm89.
gram-2.name: Gram 2

gram-3.description:
An important letter that
Wingull delivers.
gram-3.effect_long: Give to the Wingull on Unova-Route-13, along with Gram-1 and Gram-2, to receive Tm89.
gram-3.effect_short: Part of a sidequest to obtain Tm89.
gram-3.name: Gram 3

grass-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of nature.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Grass-type move one time.
grass-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Grass-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
grass-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Grass-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
grass-gem.name: Grass Gem

grass-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of a
refreshingly green field.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
grass-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
grass-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
grass-mail.name: Grass Mail

great-ball.description:
A good, high-performance Poké Ball
that provides a higher Pokémon catch
rate than a standard Poké Ball can.
great-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
great-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 1.5×.
great-ball.name: Great Ball

green-apricorn.description:
A green Apricorn.
It has a mysterious, aromatic scent.
green-apricorn.effect_long: May be given to Kurt in Azalea-Town to produce a Friend-Ball.
green-apricorn.effect_short: Used to make a Friend Ball.
green-apricorn.name: Green Apricorn

green-scarf.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
During a Contest, it raises the Smart
aspect of the Pokémon holding it.
green-scarf.effect_long: Held: Increases the holder's Smartness during a Super Contest's Visual Competition.
green-scarf.effect_short: Raises the holder's Smartness while in a contest.
green-scarf.name: Green Scarf

green-shard.description:
A small green shard. It appears
to be a fragment of some sort
of implement made long ago.
green-shard.effect_long:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a Hail TM in the house midway along the southern section of Sinnoh-Route-212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on Sinnoh-Route-212, in Snowpoint-City, and in the Survival-Area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for an Aguav-Berry, a Lum-Berry, and a Rawst-Berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in Violet-City.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a Durin-Berry, a Hondew-Berry, and a Wepear-Berry with the Juggler near the Pal-Park entrance in Fuchsia-City.
green-shard.effect_short: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.
green-shard.name: Green Shard

greet-mail.description:
Stationery designed to be easy to use
when writing someone for the first time.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
greet-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
greet-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
greet-mail.name: Greet Mail

grepa-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
Using it on a Pokémon makes it more
friendly but lowers its base Sp. Def.
grepa-berry.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Special Defense effort by 10.
grepa-berry.effect_short: Drops Special Defense Effort Values by 10 and raises happiness.
grepa-berry.name: Grepa Berry

grip-claw.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It extends the duration of multi-turn
attacks like Bind and Wrap.
grip-claw.effect_long: Held: Increases the duration of the holder's multiturn (2-5 turn) moves by three turns.
grip-claw.effect_short: Held: Holder's multi-turn trapping moves last 5 turns.
grip-claw.name: Grip Claw

griseous-orb.description:
A glowing orb to be held by Giratina.
It boosts the power of Dragon- and
Ghost-type moves when it is held.
griseous-orb.effect_long:
Held by Giratina
:   Holder's Dragon and Ghost moves have 1.2× their base power.

    Holder is in Origin Forme.

This item cannot be held by any Pokémon but Giratina.  When you enter the Union Room or connect to Wi-Fi, this item returns to your bag.
griseous-orb.effect_short: Boosts the damage from Giratina's Dragon-type and Ghost-type moves by 20%, and transforms it into Origin Forme.
griseous-orb.name: Griseous Orb

ground-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of land.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Ground-type move one time.
ground-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Ground-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
ground-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Ground-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
ground-gem.name: Ground Gem

growth-mulch.description:
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil
in regions where Berries are grown.
growth-mulch.effect_long:
Used on a patch of soil
:   Plant's growth stages will each last 25% less time.  Dries soil out more quickly.
growth-mulch.effect_short: Growing time of berries is reduced, but the soil dries out faster.
growth-mulch.name: Growth Mulch

grubby-hanky.description:
A handkerchief dropped by
a regular at Café Warehouse.
It smells faintly like a Pokémon.
grubby-hanky.effect_short: Appears in the Café Warehouse on Sunday; return to the customer with a Patrat on Thursday.
grubby-hanky.name: Grubby Hanky

guard-spec.description:
An item that prevents stat reduction
among the Trainer’s party Pokémon
for five turns after it is used in battle.
guard-spec.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Protects the target's stats from being lowered for the next five turns.  Increases happiness by 1/1/0.
guard-spec.effect_short: Prevents stat changes in battle for five turns in battle.  Raises happiness.
guard-spec.name: Guard Spec.

gyaradosite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Gyarados hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
gyaradosite.name: Gyaradosite

haban-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Dragon-type attack.
haban-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Dragon-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
haban-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Dragon-type attack to halve the damage.
haban-berry.name: Haban Berry

harbor-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL featuring a cute
WINGULL print.
It is to be held by a POKéMON.
harbor-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
harbor-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
harbor-mail.name: Harbor Mail

hard-stone.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a durable stone that boosts
the power of Rock-type moves.
hard-stone.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Rock moves by 20%.
hard-stone.effect_short: Held: Rock-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
hard-stone.name: Hard Stone

heal-ball.description:
A remedial Poké Ball that restores
the HP of a Pokémon caught with it
and eliminates any status conditions.
heal-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.  The caught Pokémon's HP is immediately restored, PP for all its moves is restored, and any status ailment is cured.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
heal-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Caught Pokémon are immediately healed.
heal-ball.name: Heal Ball

heal-powder.description:
A very bitter medicine powder.
When consumed, it heals all of
a Pokémon’s status conditions.
heal-powder.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment.  Decreases happiness by 5/5/10.
heal-powder.effect_short: Cures any status ailment, but lowers happiness.
heal-powder.name: Heal Powder

health-wing.description:
An item for use on a Pokémon.
It slightly increases the base
HP of a single Pokémon.
health-wing.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's HP effort by 1.
health-wing.name: Health Wing

heart-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of giant
heart patterns.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
heart-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
heart-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
heart-mail.name: Heart Mail

heart-scale.description:
A pretty, heart-shaped scale that is
extremely rare. It glows faintly with
all of the colors of the rainbow.
heart-scale.effect_long: Trade one to the Move Relearner near the shore in Pastoria-City or with the Move Deleter in Blackthorn-City to teach one party Pokémon a prior level-up move.
heart-scale.effect_short: No effect. Can be traded for prior Level-up moves.
heart-scale.name: Heart Scale

heat-rock.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It extends the duration of the move
Sunny Day when used by the holder.
heat-rock.effect_long: Held: The holder's Sunny Day will create sunshine lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.
heat-rock.effect_short: Held: Sunny Day by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.
heat-rock.name: Heat Rock

heavy-ball.description:
A Poké Ball that is better than usual
at catching very heavy Pokémon.
heavy-ball.effect_long:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon weighs:

    * 409.6 kg (903.0 lb) or more, its catch rate is 40 more than normal.
    * 307.2 kg (677.3 lb) or more, its catch rate is 30 more than normal.
    * 204.8 kg (451.5 lb) or more, its catch rate is 20 more than normal.
    * less than 204.8 kg (451.5 lb), its catch rate is 20 less than normal.
heavy-ball.effect_short: Has flat bonus or penalty to catch rate depending on weight class of target. Made from Blk Apricorn.
heavy-ball.name: Heavy Ball

helix-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived in the sea. It might be
a piece of a seashell.
helix-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in the Mining-Museum in Oreburgh-City or the Museum of Science in Pewter-City to receive a Omanyte.
helix-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into an Omanyte.
helix-fossil.name: Helix Fossil

heracronite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Heracross hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
heracronite.name: Heracronite

hm01.description:
The target is cut with a scythe or claw.
This can also be used to cut down thin trees.
hm01.effect_long: Teaches Cut to a compatible Pokémon.
hm01.effect_short: Teaches Cut to a compatible Pokémon.
hm01.name: HM01

hm02.description:
The user soars and then strikes
its target on the next turn. This can
also be used to fly to any familiar town.
hm02.effect_long: Teaches Fly to a compatible Pokémon.
hm02.effect_short: Teaches Fly to a compatible Pokémon.
hm02.name: HM02

hm03.description:
The user attacks everything around it by
swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
This can also be used for crossing water.
hm03.effect_long: Teaches Surf to a compatible Pokémon.
hm03.effect_short: Teaches Surf to a compatible Pokémon.
hm03.name: HM03

hm04.description:
The target is slugged with a punch thrown
at maximum power. This can also be used
to move heavy boulders.
hm04.effect_long: Teaches Strength to a compatible Pokémon.
hm04.effect_short: Teaches Strength to a compatible Pokémon.
hm04.name: HM04

hm05.description:
The user charges at the target and may make it
flinch. This can also be used to climb a waterfall.
hm05.effect_long: Teaches Defog to a compatible Pokémon.
hm05.effect_short: Teaches Waterfall to a compatible Pokémon. (HS: Whirlpool DPP: Defog Gen III & II & I: Flash)
hm05.name: HM05

hm06.description:
Diving on the first turn, the user floats
up and attacks on the next turn.
hm06.effect_long: Teaches Rock Smash to a compatible Pokémon.
hm06.effect_short: Teaches Dive to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Rock Smash Gen II: Whirlpool)
hm06.name: HM06

hm07.description:
The user charges the foe at an
awesome speed. It can also be used
to climb a waterfall.
hm07.effect_long: Teaches Waterfall to a compatible Pokémon.
hm07.effect_short: Teaches a move to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III & II: Waterfall)
hm07.name: HM07

hm08.description:
A charging attack that may also leave
the foe confused. It can also be used
to scale rocky walls.
hm08.effect_long: Teaches Rock Climb to a compatible Pokémon.
hm08.effect_short: Teaches a move to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Rock Climb Gen III: Dive)
hm08.name: HM08

holo-caster.description:
A device that allows users to receive
and view hologram clips at any time.
It is also used to chat with others.
holo-caster.name: Holo Caster

hondew-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
Using it on a Pokémon makes it more
friendly but lowers its base Sp. Atk.
hondew-berry.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Special Attack effort by 10.
hondew-berry.effect_short: Drops Special Attack Effort Values by 10 and raises happiness.
hondew-berry.name: Hondew Berry

honey.description:
A sweet honey with a lush aroma that
attracts wild Pokémon when it is used
in tall grass, in caves, or on special trees.
honey.effect_long:
Used outside of battle
:   Immediately triggers a wild Pokémon battle, as long as the trainer is somewhere with wild Pokémon—i.e., in tall grass, in a cave, or surfing.

Can be smeared on sweet-smelling trees to attract tree-dwelling Pokémon after six hours.
honey.name: Honey

honor-of-kalos.description:
A precious symbol that is awarded
only to an individual who has done
great things for the Kalos region.
honor-of-kalos.name: Honor of Kalos

houndoominite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Houndoom hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
houndoominite.name: Houndoominite

hp-up.description:
A nutritious drink for Pokémon.
When consumed, it raises the
base HP of a single Pokémon.
hp-up.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases HP effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
hp-up.name: HP Up

hyper-potion.description:
A spray-type medicine for treating
wounds. It can be used to restore
200 HP to an injured Pokémon.
hyper-potion.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 200 HP.
hyper-potion.name: Hyper Potion

iapapa-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, it restores the
user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause
confusion if the user hates the taste.
iapapa-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes sour flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Defense), it will also become confused.
iapapa-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/2 max HP to restore 1/8 max HP. Confuses Pokémon that dislike sour flavor.
iapapa-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
iapapa-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
iapapa-berry.name: Iapapa Berry

ice-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of ice.
When held, it strengthens the power
of an Ice-type move one time.
ice-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Ice-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
ice-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Ice-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
ice-gem.name: Ice Gem

ice-heal.description:
A spray-type medicine for freezing.
It can be used once to defrost a
Pokémon that has been frozen solid.
ice-heal.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures freezing.
ice-heal.name: Ice Heal

icicle-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Ice-type moves.
icicle-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ice moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Ice.
icicle-plate.effect_short: Held: Ice-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Ice.
icicle-plate.name: Icicle Plate

icy-rock.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It extends the duration of the move
Hail when it’s used by the holder.
icy-rock.effect_long: Held: The holder's Hail will create a hailstorm lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.
icy-rock.effect_short: Held: Hail by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.
icy-rock.name: Icy Rock

inquiry-mail.description:
Stationery designed to make it easier
to pose a question about something.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
inquiry-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
inquiry-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
inquiry-mail.name: Inquiry Mail

insect-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Bug-type moves.
insect-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Bug moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Bug.
insect-plate.effect_short: Held: Bug-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Bug.
insect-plate.name: Insect Plate

intriguing-stone.description:
A rather curious stone that might
appear to be valuable to some.
It’s all in the eye of the beholder.
intriguing-stone.name: Intriguing Stone

iron.description:
A nutritious drink for Pokémon.
When consumed, it raises the base
Defense stat of a single Pokémon.
iron.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Defense effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
iron.name: Iron

iron-ball.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It lowers Speed and allows Ground-type
moves to hit Flying-type and levitating holders.
iron-ball.effect_long: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  If the holder is Flying or has Levitate, it takes regular damage from Ground attacks and is suspectible to Spikes and Toxic Spikes.
iron-ball.effect_short: Held: Holder's Speed is halved. Negates all Ground-type immunities, and makes Flying-types take neutral damage from Ground-type moves. Arena Trap. Spikes, and Toxic Spikes affect the holder.
iron-ball.name: Iron Ball

iron-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Steel-type moves.
iron-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Steel moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Steel.
iron-plate.effect_short: Held: Steel-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Steel.
iron-plate.name: Iron Plate

item-drop.description:
When used, it causes an ally
Pokémon to drop a held item.
item-drop.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Selects another friendly Pokémon at random.  If that Pokémon is holding an item, that item is removed for the duration of the battle.

This item can only be obtained or used via the Wonder Launcher.
item-drop.effect_short: Forces a friendly Pokémon to drop its held item.
item-drop.name: Item Drop

item-urge.description:
When used, it causes an ally
Pokémon to use its held item.
item-urge.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Selects another friendly Pokémon at random.  If that Pokémon is holding an item normally activated by some condition—i.e., not continuous and passive—its effect is forcibly activated.

This item can only be obtained or used via the Wonder Launcher.
item-urge.effect_short: Forcibly activates a friendly Pokémon's held item.
item-urge.name: Item Urge

jaboca-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a physical attack hits the Pokémon
holding it, the attacker will also be hurt.
jaboca-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder takes physical damage, it consumes this item to damage the attacking Pokémon for 1/8 its max HP.
jaboca-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed to deal 1/8 attacker's max HP when holder is struck by a physical attack.
jaboca-berry.name: Jaboca Berry

jade-orb.description:
A shiny green orb that is said to have
a legend tied to it. It’s known to have a
deep connection with the Hoenn region.
jade-orb.effect_long: Causes Rayquaza to appear in the Embedded-Tower.
jade-orb.effect_short: Summons Rayquaza to the Embedded Tower.
jade-orb.name: Jade Orb

jaw-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived on the land. It looks as
if it could be a piece of a large jaw.
jaw-fossil.name: Jaw Fossil

journal.description:
A notebook that keeps a day-to-day
record of your adventure so far.
journal.effect_long: Records some of the trainer's activities for the day.
journal.effect_short: Records prior significant activities the player took.
journal.name: Journal

kangaskhanite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Kangaskhan hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
kangaskhanite.name: Kangaskhanite

kasib-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Ghost-type attack.
kasib-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Ghost-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
kasib-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Ghost-type attack to halve the damage.
kasib-berry.name: Kasib Berry

kebia-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Poison-type attack.
kebia-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Poison-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
kebia-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Poison-type attack to halve the damage.
kebia-berry.name: Kebia Berry

kee-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry
will increase the holder’s Defense
if it’s hit with a physical move.
kee-berry.name: Kee Berry

kelpsy-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
Using it on a Pokémon makes it more
friendly but lowers its base Attack.
kelpsy-berry.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Attack effort by 10.
kelpsy-berry.effect_short: Drops Attack Effort Values by 10 and raises happiness.
kelpsy-berry.name: Kelpsy Berry

kings-rock.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
When the holder successfully inflicts
damage, the target may also flinch.
kings-rock.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   Holder's damaging moves have a 10% chance to make their target flinch.  This chance applies independently to each hit of a multi-hit move.

    This item's chance is rolled independently of any other move effects;
e.g., a move with a 30% chance to flinch normally will have a 37% total chance to flinch when used with this item, because 3% of the time, both effects activate.

Held by Poliwhirl or Slowbro
:   Holder evolves into Politoed or Slowking, respectively, when traded.
kings-rock.effect_short: Held: Damaging moves gain a 10% chance to make their target flinch. Traded on a Poliwhirl: Holder evolves into Politoed. Traded on a Slowpoke: Holder evolves into Slowking.
kings-rock.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [paralyze]{mechanic:paralyze} the target.
kings-rock.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [paralyze]{mechanic:paralysis} the target.
kings-rock.name: King's Rock

lagging-tail.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is tremendously heavy and makes
the holder move slower than usual.
lagging-tail.effect_long: Held: The holder will go last within its move's priority bracket, regardless of Speed.  If multiple Pokémon within the same priority bracket are subject to this effect, the slower Pokémon will go first.  The holder will move after Pokémon with Stall.  If the holder has Stall, Stall is ignored.  This item ignores Trick Room.
lagging-tail.effect_short: Held: Holder moves last in its priority bracket.
lagging-tail.name: Lagging Tail

lansat-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, its critical-hit
ratio will increase when it’s in a pinch.
lansat-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its critical hit chance by one stage.
lansat-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost critical hit ratio by two stages.
lansat-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
lansat-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
lansat-berry.name: Lansat Berry

lava-cookie.description:
Lavaridge Town’s local specialty.
It can be used once to heal all the
status conditions of a Pokémon.
lava-cookie.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment and confusion.
lava-cookie.effect_short: Cures any status ailment and confusion.
lava-cookie.name: Lava Cookie

lax-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
The beguiling aroma of this incense
may cause attacks to miss its holder.
lax-incense.effect_long: Held: Increases the holder's Evasion by 5%.
lax-incense.effect_short: Held: Holder's evasion is increased by 5%. Breeding: Wobbuffet begets a Wynaut Egg.
lax-incense.name: Lax Incense

leaf-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It has an unmistakable leaf pattern.
leaf-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an Exeggcute into Exeggutor, a Gloom into Vileplume, a Nuzleaf into Shiftry, a Pansage into Simisage, or a Weepinbell into Victreebel.
leaf-stone.effect_short: Evolves an Exeggcute into Exeggutor, a Gloom into Vileplume, a Nuzleaf into Shiftry, a Pansage into Simisage, or a Weepinbell into Victreebel.
leaf-stone.name: Leaf Stone

leftovers.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
The holder’s HP is slowly but steadily
restored throughout every battle.
leftovers.effect_long: Held: Heals the holder by 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.
leftovers.effect_short: Held: Restores 1/16 (6.25%) holder's max HP at the end of each turn.
leftovers.name: Leftovers

lemonade.description:
A very sweet and refreshing drink.
When consumed, it restores
80 HP to an injured Pokémon.
lemonade.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 80 HP.
lemonade.name: Lemonade

lens-case.description:
A rather chic-looking case
for carrying contact lenses.
lens-case.name: Lens Case

leppa-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore
10 PP to a depleted move during battle.
leppa-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is out of PP for one of its moves, it consumes this item to restore 10 of that move's PP.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 PP for a selected move.
leppa-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when a move runs out of PP to restore its PP by 10.
leppa-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
leppa-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
leppa-berry.name: Leppa Berry

letter.description:
An extremely important letter to
STEVEN from the PRESIDENT of the
DEVON CORPORATION.
letter.effect_long: Contains a letter to be delivered to Steven.
letter.effect_short: A letter to Steven from the Devon Corp president.
letter.name: Letter

level-ball.description:
A Poké Ball that makes it easier to
catch Pokémon that are at a lower
level than your own Pokémon.
level-ball.effect_long:
Used by trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the trainer's Pokémon's level is higher than:

    * four times the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 8× normal.
    * than twice the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 4× normal.
    * the wild Pokémon's, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 2× normal.
level-ball.effect_short: Success rate based off of fraction target Pokémon is of user's Pokémon. Made from Red Apricorn.
level-ball.name: Level Ball

liberty-pass.description:
A special pass to go to Liberty Garden.
Board the ship in Castelia City.
liberty-pass.effect_long: Allows passage on the Castelia-City ship, which leads to Liberty-Garden and Victini.
liberty-pass.effect_short: Allows access to Liberty Garden and Victini.
liberty-pass.name: Liberty Pass

liechi-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, its Attack
stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.
liechi-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Attack by one stage.
liechi-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost Attack.
liechi-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
liechi-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
liechi-berry.name: Liechi Berry

life-orb.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts the power of moves, but
at the cost of some HP on each hit.
life-orb.effect_long: Held: Damage from the holder's moves is increased by 30%.  On each turn the holder uses a damage-inflicting move, it takes 10% its max HP in damage.
life-orb.effect_short: Held: Holder's moves inflict 30% extra damage, but cost 10% max HP.
life-orb.name: Life Orb

lift-key.description:
A key that operates the elevator
in TEAM ROCKET’s HIDEOUT.
It bears the TEAM ROCKET logo.
lift-key.effect_long: Operates the elevator in the Celadon Rocket Hideout.
lift-key.effect_short: Operates the elevator in Team Rocket's Celadon Hideout.
lift-key.name: Lift Key

light-ball.description:
An item to be held by Pikachu.
It’s a puzzling orb that boosts
its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
light-ball.effect_long: Held by Pikachu: Doubles the holder's initial Attack and Special Attack.
light-ball.effect_short: Doubles Pikachu's Attack and Special Attack. Breed on Pikachu or Raichu: Pichu Egg will have Volt Tackle.
light-ball.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [burn]{mechanic:burn} the target.
light-ball.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [burn]{mechanic:burn} the target.
light-ball.name: Light Ball

light-clay.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
Protective moves like Light Screen
and Reflect will be effective longer.
light-clay.effect_long: Held: The holder's Reflect and Light Screen will create effects lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the barrier itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.
light-clay.effect_short: Held: Light Screen and Reflect used by the holder last 8 rounds instead of 5.
light-clay.name: Light Clay

light-stone.description:
Reshiram’s body was destroyed and
changed into this stone. It is said to
be waiting for the emergence of a hero.
light-stone.effect_long: Summons Reshiram for the final battle against N.
light-stone.effect_short: Summons Reshiram for the final battle against N.
light-stone.name: Light Stone

like-mail.description:
Stationery designed to allow you to
recommend something to the reader.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
like-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
like-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
like-mail.name: Like Mail

lock-capsule.description:
A sturdy Capsule that can only
be opened with a special key.
lock-capsule.name: Lock Capsule

looker-ticket.description:
A ticket that was handmade by
Looker. It’s decorated with a
liberal amount of glittery paint.
looker-ticket.name: Looker Ticket

loot-sack.description:
A sturdy, spacious bag that is
used to carry any treasures or
loot obtained in the coal mine.
loot-sack.name: Loot Sack

lost-item.description:
The Mime Jr. doll that was lost by
the Copycat.
lost-item.effect_long: May be traded to the Copycat for a Pass.
lost-item.effect_short: A Poké Doll lost by the Copycat who lives in Saffron City. Trade for a Pass.
lost-item.name: Lost Item

love-ball.description:
A Poké Ball that works best when
catching a Pokémon that is of the
opposite gender of your Pokémon.
love-ball.effect_long:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the trainer's Pokémon and wild Pokémon are of the same species but opposite genders, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 8× normal.
love-ball.effect_short: 8× effectiveness on opposite sex, same species targets of the Active Pokémon. Made from Pnk Apricorn.
love-ball.name: Love Ball

lucarionite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Lucario hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
lucarionite.name: Lucarionite

luck-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It doubles any prize money received
if the holding Pokémon joins a battle.
luck-incense.effect_long: Held: Doubles the money the trainer receives after an in-game trainer battle.  This effect cannot apply more than once to the same battle.
luck-incense.effect_short: Held: Doubles the money earned from a battle. Does not stack with Amulet Coin. Breeding: Chansey and Blissey beget a Happiny Egg.
luck-incense.name: Luck Incense

lucky-egg.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s an egg filled with happiness that
earns extra Exp. Points in battle.
lucky-egg.effect_long: Held: Increases any Exp the holder gains by 50%.
lucky-egg.effect_short: Held: Increases EXP earned in battle by 50%.
lucky-egg.name: Lucky Egg

lucky-punch.description:
An item to be held by Chansey.
This pair of lucky boxing gloves will
boost Chansey’s critical-hit ratio.
lucky-punch.effect_long: Held by Chansey: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 2.
lucky-punch.effect_short: Raises Chansey's critical hit ratio by two stages.
lucky-punch.name: Lucky Punch

lum-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover
from any status condition during battle.
lum-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is afflicted with a major status ailment, it consumes this item to cure the ailment.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any major status ailment.
lum-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed to cure any status condition or confusion.
lum-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
lum-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
lum-berry.name: Lum Berry

luminous-moss.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts Sp. Def if hit with a Water-
type attack. It can only be used once.
luminous-moss.name: Luminous Moss

lumiose-galette.description:
A popular treat in Lumiose City.
It can be used once to heal all the
status conditions of a Pokémon.
lumiose-galette.name: Lumiose Galette

lunar-wing.description:
A feather that glows like the moon.
It’s said to possess the power to
dispel nightmares.
lunar-wing.effect_long: Cures the sailor's son of his nightmares; no reward, only a side effect of seeing Cresselia.
lunar-wing.effect_short: Cures sailor's son of nightmares in Canalave City.
lunar-wing.name: Lunar Wing

lure-ball.description:
A Poké Ball that is good for catching
Pokémon that you reel in with a Rod
while out fishing.
lure-ball.effect_long:
Used by trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon was encountered by fishing, the wild Pokémon's catch rate is 3× normal.
lure-ball.effect_short: 3× effectiveness while fishing. Made from Blu Apricorn.
lure-ball.name: Lure Ball

lustrous-orb.description:
A beautifully glowing orb to be held by
Palkia. It boosts the power of Dragon-​
and Water-type moves when it is held.
lustrous-orb.effect_long:
Held by Palkia
:   Holder's Dragon- and Water-type moves have 1.2× their usual power.
lustrous-orb.effect_short: Boosts the damage from Palkia's Dragon-type and Water-type moves by 20%.
lustrous-orb.name: Lustrous Orb

luxury-ball.description:
A particularly comfortable Poké Ball
that makes a wild Pokémon quickly
grow friendlier after being caught.
luxury-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.  Whenever the caught Pokémon's happiness increases, it increases by one extra point.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
luxury-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Caught Pokémon start with 200 happiness.
luxury-ball.name: Luxury Ball

mach-bike.description:
A folding bicycle that is at least
twice as fast as walking.
mach-bike.effect_long: Increases movement speed outside or in caves.  Faster than the Acro-Bike.  Allows the trainer to ascend muddy slopes.
mach-bike.effect_short: Faster than the Acro Bike, and can ride up sandy slopes and across cracked floors.
mach-bike.name: Mach Bike

machine-part.description:
An important part of a machine that
was stolen from the Power Plant.
machine-part.effect_long: Must be replaced in the Power-Plant to power the Magnet Train.
machine-part.effect_short: Must be replaced in the Power Plant to power the Magnet Train.
machine-part.name: Machine Part

macho-brace.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This stiff, heavy brace helps Pokémon
grow strong but cuts Speed in battle.
macho-brace.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder would gain effort due to battle, it gains double that effort instead.

Held in battle
:   Holder has half its Speed.
macho-brace.effect_short: Held: Holder gains double effort values from battles, but has halved Speed in battle.
macho-brace.name: Macho Brace

magma-emblem.description:
A medal-like item in
the same shape as
TEAM MAGMA’s mark.
magma-emblem.effect_long: Provides access to the Magma-Hideout in the Jagged-Pass.
magma-emblem.effect_short: Provides access to the Team Magma Hideout in the Jagged Pass.
magma-emblem.name: Magma Emblem

magma-stone.description:
A stone formed by boulders melting in
intensely hot magma, then hardening.
Magma remains sealed inside it.
magma-stone.effect_long:
Causes Heatran to appear at Reversal Mountain.

Unused prior to Black and White 2.
magma-stone.name: Magma Stone

magmarizer.description:
A box packed with a tremendous
amount of magma energy.
It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.
magmarizer.effect_long: Held by Magmar: Evolves the holder into Magmortar when traded.
magmarizer.effect_short: Traded on a Magmar: Holder evolves into Magmortar.
magmarizer.name: Magmarizer

magnet.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a powerful magnet that boosts
the power of Electric-type moves.
magnet.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Electric moves by 20%.
magnet.effect_short: Held: Electric-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
magnet.name: Magnet

mago-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, it restores the
user’s HP in a pinch, but it will cause
confusion if the user hates the taste.
mago-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/8 its max HP.  If the holder dislikes sweet flavors (i.e., has a nature that lowers Speed), it will also become confused.
mago-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/2 max HP to restore 1/8 max HP. Confuses Pokémon that dislike sweet flavor.
mago-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
mago-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
mago-berry.name: Mago Berry

magost-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
magost-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
magost-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
magost-berry.name: Magost Berry

manectite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Manectric hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
manectite.name: Manectite

maranga-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
increase the holder’s Sp. Def
if it’s hit with a special move.
maranga-berry.name: Maranga Berry

master-ball.description:
The best Poké Ball with the ultimate
level of performance. With it, you will
catch any wild Pokémon without fail.
master-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Catches a wild Pokémon without fail.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
master-ball.effect_short: Catches a wild Pokémon every time.
master-ball.name: Master Ball

mawilite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Mawile hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
mawilite.name: Mawilite

max-elixir.description:
This medicine can fully restore the
PP of all of the moves that have
been learned by a Pokémon.
max-elixir.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores PP to full for each move.
max-elixir.effect_short: Restores PP to full for each move.
max-elixir.name: Max Elixir

max-ether.description:
This medicine can fully restore the
PP of a single selected move that
has been learned by a Pokémon.
max-ether.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores PP to full for a selected move.
max-ether.effect_short: Restores PP to full for one move.
max-ether.name: Max Ether

max-potion.description:
A spray-type medicine for treating
wounds. It will completely restore
the max HP of a single Pokémon.
max-potion.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores HP to full.
max-potion.name: Max Potion

max-repel.description:
An item that prevents any low-level
wild Pokémon from jumping out at
you for 250 steps after its use.
max-repel.effect_long:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 250 steps.
max-repel.effect_short: For 250 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.
max-repel.name: Max Repel

max-revive.description:
A medicine that can revive fainted
Pokémon. It also fully restores a
fainted Pokémon’s maximum HP.
max-revive.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Revives the Pokémon and restores its HP to full.
max-revive.name: Max Revive

meadow-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Grass-type moves.
meadow-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Grass moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Grass.
meadow-plate.effect_short: Held: Grass-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Grass.
meadow-plate.name: Meadow Plate

mech-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL featuring a cute
MAGNEMITE print.
It is to be held by a POKéMON.
mech-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
mech-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
mech-mail.name: Mech Mail

medal-box.description:
A box-shaped machine
that stores Medals and
Medal information.
medal-box.effect_short: Holds medals recieved in the medal rally.
medal-box.name: Medal Box

medichamite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Medicham hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
medichamite.name: Medichamite

mega-ring.description:
This ring contains an untold power that
somehow enables Pokémon carrying
Mega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.
mega-ring.name: Mega Ring

member-card.description:
A card needed for entering the inn in
Canalave City. Oddly, the last date
marked on it was 50 years ago.
member-card.effect_long: Provides access to Newmoon Island and Darkrai.
member-card.effect_short: Allows access to Newmoon Island and Darkrai.
member-card.name: Member Card

mental-herb.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It snaps the holder out of infatuation.
It can be used only once.
mental-herb.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is attracted, it consumes this item to cure the attraction.
mental-herb.effect_short: Held: Consumed to cure infatuation. Gen V: Also removes Taunt, Encore, Torment, Disable, and Cursed Body.
mental-herb.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  [Drains]{mechanic:drain} half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
mental-herb.fling_effect_short: Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.
mental-herb.name: Mental Herb

metal-coat.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a special metallic film that can
boost the power of Steel-type moves.
metal-coat.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Steel moves by 20%.
Held by Onix or Scyther: Evolves the holder into Steelix or Scizor when traded, respectively.
metal-coat.effect_short: Held: Steel-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
metal-coat.name: Metal Coat

metal-powder.description:
An item to be held by Ditto.
Extremely fine yet hard, this odd
powder boosts the Defense stat.
metal-powder.effect_long: Held by Ditto: Increases the holder's initial Defense and Special Defense by 50%.
metal-powder.effect_short: Raises Ditto's Defense and Special Defense by 50%. The boost is lost after transforming.
metal-powder.name: Metal Powder

meteorite.description:
A meteorite that fell from space
onto MT. MOON long ago.
It is very lumpy and hard.
meteorite.effect_long:
RSE: May be traded to Professor Cozmo for Tm27.

FRLG: A meteorite to be delivered to Lostelle's father.
meteorite.effect_short: FL: Deliver to Lostelle's father. RSE: Trade to Professor Cozmo for TM27 (Return).
meteorite.name: Meteorite

metronome.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts moves used consecutively,
but only until a different move is used.
metronome.effect_long: Held: Each time the holder uses the same move consecutively, its power is increased by another 10% of its original, to a maximum of 100%.
metronome.effect_short: Held: Consectutive uses of the same attack have a cumulative damage boost of 10%. Maximum 100% boost.
metronome.name: Metronome

mewtwonite-x.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Mewtwo hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
mewtwonite-x.name: Mewtwonite X

mewtwonite-y.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Mewtwo hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
mewtwonite-y.name: Mewtwonite Y

micle-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, its accuracy will
increase just once when it’s in a pinch.
micle-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item, and its next used move has 1.2× its normal accuracy.
micle-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost accuracy of next move by 20%. (Gen IV: Perfect accuracy)
micle-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
micle-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
micle-berry.name: Micle Berry

mind-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Psychic-type moves.
mind-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Psychic moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Psychic.
mind-plate.effect_short: Held: Psychic-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Psychic.
mind-plate.name: Mind Plate

miracle-seed.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a seed imbued with life force that
boosts the power of Grass-type moves.
miracle-seed.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Grass moves by 20%.
miracle-seed.effect_short: Held: Grass-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
miracle-seed.name: Miracle Seed

moomoo-milk.description:
A bottle of highly nutritious milk.
When consumed, it restores
100 HP to an injured Pokémon.
moomoo-milk.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 100 HP.
moomoo-milk.name: Moomoo Milk

moon-ball.description:
A Poké Ball that will make it easier
to catch Pokémon that can evolve
using a Moon Stone.
moon-ball.effect_long:
Used by trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

    If the wild Pokémon is a Clefairy, Nidoran-M, Nidoran-F, Jigglypuff, Skitty, or any evolution thereof, the wild Pokémon has 4× its catch rate.
moon-ball.effect_short: 4× effectiveness on familes of Pokémon with a Moon Stone evolution. Made from Ylw Apricorn.
moon-ball.name: Moon Ball

moon-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It is as black as the night sky.
moon-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a Clefairy into Clefable, a Jigglypuff into Wigglytuff, a Munna into Musharna, a Nidorina into Nidoqueen, a Nidorino into Nidoking, or a Skitty into Delcatty.
moon-stone.effect_short: Evolves a Clefairy into Clefable, a Jigglypuff into Wigglytuff, a Munna into Musharna, a Nidorina into Nidoqueen, a Nidorino into Nidoking, or a Skitty into Delcatty.
moon-stone.name: Moon Stone

mosaic-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of a vivid
rainbow pattern.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
mosaic-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
mosaic-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
mosaic-mail.name: Mosaic Mail

muscle-band.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This headband exudes strength, slightly
boosting the power of physical moves.
muscle-band.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's physical moves by 10%.
muscle-band.effect_short: Held: Boosts the damage of physical moves used by the holder by 10%.
muscle-band.name: Muscle Band

muscle-wing.description:
An item for use on a Pokémon.
It slightly increases the base Attack
stat of a single Pokémon.
muscle-wing.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Attack effort by 1.
muscle-wing.name: Muscle Wing

mystery-egg.description:
A mysterious Egg obtained from Mr. Pokémon.
What is in the Egg is unknown.
mystery-egg.effect_long: Must be obtained to trigger the break-in at Professor Elm's lab, the first rival battle, and access to Johto-Route-31.
mystery-egg.name: Mystery Egg

mystic-water.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This teardrop-shaped gem boosts
the power of Water-type moves.
mystic-water.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.
mystic-water.effect_short: Held: Water-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
mystic-water.name: Mystic Water

mysticticket.description:
A ticket required to board the ship
to NAVEL ROCK.
It glows with a mystic light.
mysticticket.effect_long: Provides access to Navel Rock, Ho-Oh, and Lugia.
mysticticket.effect_short: Allows access to Navel Rock and Lugia or Ho-oh.
mysticticket.name: MysticTicket

nanab-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
nanab-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
nanab-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
nanab-berry.name: Nanab Berry

nest-ball.description:
A somewhat different Poké Ball that
becomes more effective the lower
the level of the wild Pokémon.
nest-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of given by `(40 - level) / 10`, where `level` is the wild Pokémon's level, to a maximum of 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon's level is higher than 30, this ball has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
nest-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3.9× for level 1 Pokémon, and drops steadily to 1× at level 30.
nest-ball.name: Nest Ball

net-ball.description:
A somewhat different Poké Ball that
is more effective when attempting
to catch Water- or Bug-type Pokémon.
net-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon is Water- or Bug-type, this ball has a catch rate of 3×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
net-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3× for water and bug Pokémon.
net-ball.name: Net Ball

never-melt-ice.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a piece of ice that repels heat
effects and boosts Ice-type moves.
never-melt-ice.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ice moves by 20%.
never-melt-ice.effect_short: Held: Ice-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
never-melt-ice.name: Never-Melt Ice

nomel-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
nomel-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
nomel-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
nomel-berry.name: Nomel Berry

normal-gem.description:
A gem with an ordinary essence.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Normal-type move one time.
normal-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Normal-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
normal-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Normal-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
normal-gem.name: Normal Gem

nugget.description:
A nugget of the purest gold that gives
off a lustrous gleam in direct light.
It can be sold at a high price to shops.
nugget.effect_short: Sell for 5000 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 10000 Pokédollars.
nugget.name: Nugget

oaks-letter.description:
A letter from Professor Oak.
Written in it is a request for you
to go to Route 224.
oaks-letter.effect_long: Grants access to Flower Paradise and Shaymin.
oaks-letter.effect_short: Allows access to Seabreak path, Flower Paradise, and Shaymin.
oaks-letter.name: Oak's Letter

oaks-parcel.description:
A parcel to be delivered to PROF.
OAK from VIRIDIAN CITY’s POKéMON
MART.
oaks-parcel.effect_long: A parcel to be delivered to Professor Oak for a Pokédex.
oaks-parcel.effect_short: Trade to Prof. Oak for a Pokédex.
oaks-parcel.name: Oak's Parcel

occa-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Fire-type attack.
occa-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Fire-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
occa-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Fire-type attack to halve the damage.
occa-berry.name: Occa Berry

odd-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This exotic-smelling incense boosts
the power of Psychic-type moves.
odd-incense.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Psychic moves by 20%.
odd-incense.effect_short: Held: Psychic-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Mr. Mime begets a Mime Jr. Egg.
odd-incense.name: Odd Incense

odd-keystone.description:
A vital item that is needed to keep a
stone tower from collapsing. Voices
can be heard from it occasionally.
odd-keystone.effect_long: Place in the tower on Sinnoh-Route-209.  Check the stone to encounter a Spiritomb, as long as the trainer's Underground status card counts at least 32 greetings.
odd-keystone.effect_short: Use on the tower on Route 209 to encounter Spiritomb if you have at least 32 Underground greetings.
odd-keystone.name: Odd Keystone

old-amber.description:
A piece of amber that still contains the
genetic material of an ancient Pokémon.
It’s clear with a tawny, reddish tint.
old-amber.effect_long: Give to a scientist in the Mining-Museum in Oreburgh-City or the Museum of Science in Pewter-City to receive a Aerodactyl.
old-amber.effect_short: Can be revived into an Aerodactyl.
old-amber.name: Old Amber

old-charm.description:
An ancient good-luck charm made
of Pokémon bones to be taken to
the elder of Celestic Town.
old-charm.effect_long: Given to Cynthia's grandmother to get the Surf HM.
old-charm.effect_short: Trade to Cynthia's grandmother in Celestic Town for HM04 (Surf).
old-charm.name: Old Charm

old-gateau.description:
The Old Chateau’s hidden specialty.
It can be used once to heal all the
status conditions of a Pokémon.
old-gateau.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures any status ailment and confusion.
old-gateau.effect_short: Cures any status ailment and confusion.
old-gateau.name: Old Gateau

old-rod.description:
An old and beat-up fishing rod.
Use it at any body of water to
fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.
old-rod.effect_long: Used to find Pokémon on the Old Rod list for an area, which are generally Magikarp or similar.
old-rod.effect_short: Used to catch Pokémon in bodies of water.
old-rod.name: Old Rod

old-sea-map.description:
A faded sea chart
that shows the way
to a certain island.
old-sea-map.effect_long: Provides access to Faraway Island and Mew.
old-sea-map.effect_short: Allows access to Faraway Island and Mew. Unreleased outside of Japan.
old-sea-map.name: Old Sea Map

oran-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its
own HP by 10 points during battle.
oran-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 10 HP.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 10 HP.
oran-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/2 max HP to recover 10 HP.
oran-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
oran-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
oran-berry.name: Oran Berry

orange-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL featuring a cute
ZIGZAGOON print.
It is to be held by a POKéMON.
orange-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
orange-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
orange-mail.name: Orange Mail

oval-charm.description:
An oval charm said to increase
the chance of Pokémon Eggs
being found at the Day Care.
oval-charm.effect_short: Doubles the chance of two Pokémon producing an egg at the daycare every 255 steps.
oval-charm.name: Oval Charm

oval-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It’s as round as a Pokémon Egg.
oval-stone.effect_long:
Held by Happiny
:   Holder evolves into Chansey when it levels up during the daytime.
oval-stone.effect_short: Level-up during Day on a Happiny: Holder evolves into Chansey.
oval-stone.name: Oval Stone

pal-pad.description:
A convenient notepad that is used to
register your Friends and friend codes
and keep a record of your gameplay.
pal-pad.effect_long: Contains friend codes for up to 32 other players, as well as their sprite, gender, and basic statistics for those that have been seen on WFC.
pal-pad.effect_short: Use to record Friend Codes and check your own.
pal-pad.name: Pal Pad

pamtre-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
pamtre-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
pamtre-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
pamtre-berry.name: Pamtre Berry

paralyze-heal.description:
A spray-type medicine for paralysis.
It can be used once to free a
Pokémon that has been paralyzed.
paralyze-heal.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures paralysis.
paralyze-heal.name: Paralyze Heal

parcel.description:
A parcel entrusted into your care.
You are supposed to deliver it to your
childhood friend who left Twinleaf Town.
parcel.effect_long: Given to the trainer's rival in Jubilife City.  Contains two Town Maps, one of which is given to the trainer upon delivery.
parcel.effect_short: Given to the trainer's rival in Jubilife City. Contains Town Maps.
parcel.name: Parcel

park-ball.description: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.
park-ball.effect_long:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Catches a wild Pokémon.

This item can only be used in Pal-Park.
park-ball.effect_short: Catches Pokémon in the Pal Park every time.
park-ball.name: Park Ball

pass.description:
A pass required for riding the Magnet
Train. It allows you to ride whenever
and however much you’d like.
pass.effect_long: Allows the trainer to ride the Magnet Train between Goldenrod-City and Saffron-City.
pass.effect_short: Grants access to ride the Magnet Train between Goldenrod City and Saffron City.
pass.name: Pass

pass-orb.description:
A mysterious orb containing the power
of the Unova region, to be used when
generating Pass Power.
pass-orb.effect_long: Acts as currency to activate Pass Powers in the Entralink.
pass-orb.name: Pass Orb

passho-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Water-type attack.
passho-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Water-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
passho-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Water-type attack to halve the damage.
passho-berry.name: Passho Berry

payapa-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Psychic-type attack.
payapa-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Psychic-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
payapa-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Psychic-type attack to halve the damage.
payapa-berry.name: Payapa Berry

pearl.description:
A rather small pearl that has a
very nice silvery sheen to it.
It can be sold cheaply to shops.
pearl.effect_short: Sell for 700 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 1400 Pokédollars.
pearl.name: Pearl

pearl-string.description:
Very large pearls that sparkle in
a pretty silver color. They can be
sold at a high price to shops.
pearl-string.effect_short: Sell to Ore Collector for 25000 Pokédollars.
pearl-string.name: Pearl String

pecha-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover
from poisoning on its own in battle.
pecha-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is poisoned, it consumes this item to cure the poison.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures poison.
pecha-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when poisoned to cure poison.
pecha-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
pecha-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
pecha-berry.name: Pecha Berry

permit.description:
A permit that is needed to
enter the Nature Preserve.
Not many know about it.
permit.effect_short: Grants access to the Nature Preserve.
permit.name: Permit

persim-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover
from confusion on its own in battle.
persim-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is confused, it consumes this item to cure the confusion.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures confusion.
persim-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when confused to cure confusion.
persim-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
persim-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
persim-berry.name: Persim Berry

petaya-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Atk
stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.
petaya-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Special Attack by one stage.
petaya-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost Special Attack.
petaya-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
petaya-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
petaya-berry.name: Petaya Berry

photo-album.description:
A nice photo album for storing all the
photos taken along your adventure.
photo-album.name: Photo Album

pinap-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
pinap-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
pinap-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
pinap-berry.name: Pinap Berry

pink-apricorn.description:
A pink Apricorn.
It has a nice, sweet scent.
pink-apricorn.effect_long: May be given to Kurt in Azalea-Town to produce a Love-Ball.
pink-apricorn.effect_short: Used to make a Love Ball.
pink-apricorn.name: Pink Apricorn

pink-scarf.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
During a Contest, it raises the Cute
aspect of the Pokémon holding it.
pink-scarf.effect_long: Held: Increases the holder's Cuteness during a Super Contest's Visual Competition.
pink-scarf.effect_short: Raises the holder's Cuteness while in a contest.
pink-scarf.name: Pink Scarf

pinsirite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Pinsir hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
pinsirite.name: Pinsirite

pixie-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Fairy-type moves.
pixie-plate.name: Pixie Plate

plasma-card.description:
A card key needed to enter the
password inside the Plasma Frigate.
plasma-card.effect_short: Required to progress in the Plasma Frigate.
plasma-card.name: Plasma Card

plume-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived in the sky. It looks as
if it could come from part of its wing.
plume-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in a museum to receive a Archen.
plume-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into a Archen.
plume-fossil.name: Plume Fossil

poffin-case.description: A case for storing Poffins cooked from Berries.
poffin-case.name: Poffin Case

point-card.description:
A card that lists how many
Battle Points you have earned.
point-card.effect_short: Keeps count of Battle Points earned.
point-card.name: Point Card

poison-barb.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This small, poisonous barb boosts
the power of Poison-type moves.
poison-barb.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Poison moves by 20%.
poison-barb.effect_short: Held: Poison-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
poison-barb.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [freeze]{mechanic:freeze} the target.
poison-barb.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [freeze]{mechanic:freeze} the target.
poison-barb.name: Poison Barb

poison-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of poison.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Poison-type move one time.
poison-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Poison-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
poison-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Poison-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
poison-gem.name: Poison Gem

poke-ball.description:
A device for catching wild Pokémon.
It’s thrown like a ball at a Pokémon,
comfortably encapsulating its target.
poke-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
poke-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.
poke-ball.name: Poké Ball

poke-doll.description:
A doll that attracts the attention of a
Pokémon. It guarantees escape from
any battle with wild Pokémon.
poke-doll.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Ends a wild battle.  Cannot be used in trainer battles.
poke-doll.name: Poké Doll

poke-flute.description:
A flute which can play with such a
beautiful tone that even sleeping
Pokémon find themselves roused.
poke-flute.effect_long: Wakes up sleeping Pokémon.  Required to wake up sleeping Snorlax on the overworld.
poke-flute.effect_short: Use to awaken sleeping Pokémon, including Snorlax on roads.
poke-flute.name: Poké Flute

poke-radar.description:
A tool that can search out Pokémon
that are hiding in the tall grass. Its
battery is recharged as you walk.
