poke-radar.effect_long: Designates several nearby patches of grass as containing Pokémon, some of which may be special radar-only Pokémon.  Successive uses in a certain way create chains of encounters with the same species; longer chains increase the chance that a shiny Pokémon of that species will appear.
poke-radar.effect_short: Use to track down rare or shiny Pokémon. 50 steps to recharge.
poke-radar.name: Poké Radar

poke-toy.description:
A toy that attracts the attention of a
Pokémon. It guarantees escape from
any battle with a wild Pokémon.
poke-toy.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Ends a wild battle.  Cannot be used in trainer battles.
poke-toy.name: Poké Toy

pokeblock-case.description:
A case for holding POKéBLOCKS made
with a BERRY BLENDER. It releases
one POKéBLOCK when shaken.
pokeblock-case.name: Pokéblock Case

pomeg-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
Using it on a Pokémon makes it more
friendly but lowers its base HP.
pomeg-berry.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers HP effort by 10.
pomeg-berry.effect_short: Drops HP Effort Values by 10 and raises happiness.
pomeg-berry.name: Pomeg Berry

potion.description:
A spray-type medicine for treating
wounds. It can be used to restore
20 HP to an injured Pokémon.
potion.effect_long:
Used on a friendly Pokémon
:   Restores 20 HP.
potion.name: Potion

powder-jar.description:
A jar for storing BERRY POWDER
made using a BERRY CRUSHER.
powder-jar.effect_long: Holds Berry Powder from Berry Crushing.
powder-jar.effect_short: Stores Berry Powder made using a Berry Crusher.
powder-jar.name: Powder Jar

power-anklet.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It reduces Speed but allows the holder’s
Speed stat to grow more after battling.
power-anklet.effect_long: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Speed effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.
power-anklet.effect_short: Held: Holder gains 4 Speed effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.
power-anklet.name: Power Anklet

power-band.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It reduces Speed but allows the holder’s
Sp. Def stat to grow more after battling.
power-band.effect_long: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Special Defense effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.
power-band.effect_short: Held: Holder gains 4 Special Defense effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.
power-band.name: Power Band

power-belt.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It reduces Speed but allows the holder’s
Defense stat to grow more after battling.
power-belt.effect_long: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Defense effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.
power-belt.effect_short: Held: Holder gains 4 Defense effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.
power-belt.name: Power Belt

power-bracer.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It reduces Speed but allows the holder’s
Attack stat to grow more after battling.
power-bracer.effect_long: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Attack effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.
power-bracer.effect_short: Held: Holder gains 4 Attack effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.
power-bracer.name: Power Bracer

power-herb.description:
A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon.
It allows the holder to immediately use a
move that normally requires a turn to charge.
power-herb.effect_long: Held: Whenever the holder uses a move that requires a turn to charge first (Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Razor Wind, Skull Bash, Sky Attack, or Solarbeam), this item is consumed and the charge is skipped.  Skull Bash still provides a Defense boost.
power-herb.effect_short: Held: Both turns of a two-turn charge move happen at once. Consumed upon use.
power-herb.name: Power Herb

power-lens.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It reduces Speed but allows the holder’s
Sp. Atk stat to grow more after battling.
power-lens.effect_long: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains Special Attack effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.
power-lens.effect_short: Held: Holder gains 4 Special Attack effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.
power-lens.name: Power Lens

power-plant-pass.description:
This pass serves as an ID card
for gaining access to the power
plant that lies along Route 13.
power-plant-pass.name: Power Plant Pass

power-weight.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It reduces Speed but allows the holder’s
maximum HP to grow more after battling.
power-weight.effect_long: Held: Decreases the holder's Speed by 50%.  Whenever the holder gains HP effort from battle, increases that effort by 4; this applies before the PokéRUS doubling effect.
power-weight.effect_short: Held: Holder gains 4 HP effort values, but has halved Speed in battle.
power-weight.name: Power Weight

pp-max.description:
A medicine that can optimally raise the
maximum PP of a single move that has
been learned by the target Pokémon.
pp-max.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases a selected move's max PP to 1.6× its original max PP.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
pp-max.effect_short: Raises a move's max PP by 60%.
pp-max.name: PP Max

pp-up.description:
A medicine that can slightly raise the
maximum PP of a single move that has
been learned by the target Pokémon.
pp-up.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases a selected move's max PP by 20% its original max PP, to a maximum of 1.6×.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
pp-up.effect_short: Raises a move's max PP by 20%.
pp-up.name: PP Up

premier-ball.description:
A somewhat rare Poké Ball that was
made as a commemorative item used
to celebrate an event of some sort.
premier-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
premier-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.
premier-ball.name: Premier Ball

pretty-wing.description:
Though this feather is beautiful,
it’s just a regular feather and
has no effect on Pokémon.
pretty-wing.name: Pretty Wing

prism-scale.description:
A mysterious scale that causes
a certain Pokémon to evolve.
It shines in rainbow colors.
prism-scale.effect_long:
Held by Feebas
:   Holder evolves into Milotic when traded.
prism-scale.effect_short: Traded on a Feebas: Holder evolves into Milotic.
prism-scale.name: Prism Scale

profs-letter.description:
A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote
to your mother. A faint but pleasant
perfume seems to cling to the paper.
profs-letter.name: Prof's Letter

prop-case.description:
A lovely case to store colorful Props
for your Pokémon to wear in a musical.
prop-case.effect_long: Stores props for the Pokémon Musical.
prop-case.effect_short: Stores props for the Pokémon Musical.
prop-case.name: Prop Case

protector.description:
A protective item of some sort.
It is extremely stiff and heavy.
It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.
protector.effect_long: Held by Rhydon: Evolves the holder into Rhyperior when traded.
protector.effect_short: Traded on a Rhydon: Holder evolves into Rhyperior.
protector.name: Protector

protein.description:
A nutritious drink for Pokémon.
When consumed, it raises the base
Attack stat of a single Pokémon.
protein.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases Attack effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
protein.name: Protein

psychic-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of the mind.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Psychic-type move one time.
psychic-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Psychic-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
psychic-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Psychic-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
psychic-gem.name: Psychic Gem

pure-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It helps keep wild Pokémon away if
the holder is the head of the party.
pure-incense.effect_long: Held by lead Pokémon: Prevents wild battles with Pokémon that are lower level than the holder.
pure-incense.effect_short: Prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon. Breeding: Chimecho begets a Chingling Egg.
pure-incense.name: Pure Incense

qualot-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
Using it on a Pokémon makes it more
friendly but lowers its base Defense.
qualot-berry.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Defense effort by 10.
qualot-berry.effect_short: Drops Defense Effort Values by 10 and raises happiness.
qualot-berry.name: Qualot Berry

quick-ball.description:
A somewhat different Poké Ball that
has a more successful catch rate if
used at the start of a wild encounter.
quick-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 4× on the first turn of a battle, but 1× any other time.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
quick-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate is 4× (Gen V: 5×), but only on the first turn.
quick-ball.name: Quick Ball

quick-claw.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This light, sharp claw lets the
bearer move first occasionally.
quick-claw.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   Whenever the holder attempts to use a move, it has a 3/16 chance to act first among moves with the same priority.  If multiple Pokémon have this effect at the same time, Speed is the tie-breaker as normal, but the effect of Trick-Room is ignored.
quick-claw.effect_short: Held: Holder has a 3/16 (18.75%) chance to move first.
quick-claw.name: Quick Claw

quick-powder.description:
An item to be held by Ditto.
Extremely fine yet hard, this odd
powder boosts the Speed stat.
quick-powder.effect_long: Held by Ditto: Doubles the holder's initial Speed.
quick-powder.effect_short: Doubles Ditto's Speed when held. The boost is lost after transforming.
quick-powder.name: Quick Powder

rabuta-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
rabuta-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
rabuta-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
rabuta-berry.name: Rabuta Berry

rage-candy-bar.description:
Mahogany Town’s famous candy.
When consumed, it restores
20 HP to an injured Pokémon.
rage-candy-bar.effect_long: May be traded for a Tm64 in the vertical Underground Path.
rage-candy-bar.effect_short: HS: Traded for TM64. Gen II & Gen V: Acts as a Potion.
rage-candy-bar.name: Rage Candy Bar

rainbow-pass.description:
A pass for ferries between
VERMILION and the SEVII ISLANDS.
It features a drawing of a rainbow.
rainbow-pass.effect_long: Provides access to the Sevii Islands.
rainbow-pass.effect_short: Grants access to all of the Sevii Islands.
rainbow-pass.name: Rainbow Pass

rainbow-wing.description:
A mystical rainbow feather
that sparkles.
rainbow-wing.effect_long: Causes Ho-Oh to appear at the top of Bell-Tower.
rainbow-wing.effect_short: Summons Ho-Oh at the top of the Bell Tower.
rainbow-wing.name: Rainbow Wing

rare-bone.description:
A rare bone that is extremely valuable
for the study of Pokémon archeology.
It can be sold for a high price to shops.
rare-bone.effect_short: Sell for 5000 Pokédollars, or to Bone Man for 10000 Pokédollars.
rare-bone.name: Rare Bone

rare-candy.description:
A candy that is packed with energy.
When consumed, it will instantly raise
the level of a single Pokémon by one.
rare-candy.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases level by 1.  Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
rare-candy.effect_short: Causes a level-up and raises happiness.
rare-candy.name: Rare Candy

rawst-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover
from a burn on its own in battle.
rawst-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder is burned, it consumes this item to cure the burn.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Cures a burn.
rawst-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when burned to cure a burn.
rawst-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
rawst-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
rawst-berry.name: Rawst Berry

razor-claw.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This sharply hooked claw increases
the holder’s critical-hit ratio.
razor-claw.effect_long:
Held: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 1.
Held by Sneasel: Evolves the holder into Weavile when it levels up during the night.
razor-claw.effect_short: Held: Raises the holder's critical hit ratio by one stage. Held by a Sneasel while levelling up at night: Holder evolves into Weavile.
razor-claw.name: Razor Claw

razor-fang.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
When the holder successfully inflicts
damage, the target may also flinch.
razor-fang.effect_long:
Held: When the holder attacks with most damaging moves, provides an extra 11.7% (30/256) chance for the target to flinch.
Held by Gligar: Evolves the holder into Gliscor when it levels up.
razor-fang.effect_short: Held: Damaging moves gain a 10% chance to make their target flinch. Held by a Gligar while levelling up: Holder evolves into Gliscor.
razor-fang.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [paralyze]{mechanic:paralyze} the target.
razor-fang.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [paralyze]{mechanic:paralysis} the target.
razor-fang.name: Razor Fang

razz-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
razz-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
razz-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
razz-berry.name: Razz Berry

reaper-cloth.description:
A cloth imbued with horrifyingly
strong spiritual energy.
It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.
reaper-cloth.effect_long: Held by Dusclops: Evolves the holder into Dusknoir when traded.
reaper-cloth.effect_short: Traded on a Dusclops: Holder evolves into Dusknoir.
reaper-cloth.name: Reaper Cloth

red-apricorn.description:
A red Apricorn.
It assails your nostrils.
red-apricorn.effect_long: May be given to Kurt in Azalea-Town to produce a Level-Ball.
red-apricorn.effect_short: Used to make a Level Ball.
red-apricorn.name: Red Apricorn

red-card.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
When the holder is hit by an attack,
the attacker is removed from battle.
red-card.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder takes damage directly from a move and does not faint, it switches out for another random, non-fainted Pokémon in its party.
This effect does not activate if another effect prevents the holder from switching out.
red-card.effect_short: Held: When the holder takes damage from a move, the opponent switches out for another random party Pokémon. Consumed after use.
red-card.name: Red Card

red-chain.description:
A mythical chain that is said to link
the Legendary Pokémon that created
the Sinnoh region.
red-chain.effect_short: Used to bind Palkia and Dialga.
red-chain.name: Red Chain

red-flute.description:
A lovely toy flute to admire.
It’s made from red glass.
red-flute.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Cures attraction.
red-flute.name: Red Flute

red-orb.description:
A shiny red orb that is said to have
a legend tied to it. It’s known to have a
deep connection with the Hoenn region.
red-orb.effect_long: Causes Groudon to appear in the Embedded-Tower.
red-orb.effect_short: Summons Groudon to the Embedded Tower.
red-orb.name: Red Orb

red-scale.description:
A scale from a red Gyarados.
It glows red like a flame.
red-scale.effect_long: May be traded to Mr. Pokémon for an Exp-Share.
red-scale.effect_short: Trade to Mr. Pokémon for an Exp. Share.
red-scale.name: Red Scale

red-scarf.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
During a Contest, it raises the Cool
aspect of the Pokémon holding it.
red-scarf.effect_long: Held: Increases the holder's Coolness during a Super Contest's Visual Competition.
red-scarf.effect_short: Raises the holder's Coolness while in a contest.
red-scarf.name: Red Scarf

red-shard.description:
A small red shard. It appears
to be a fragment of some sort
of implement made long ago.
red-shard.effect_long:
No effect.

In Diamond and Pearl, trade ten for a Sunny-Day TM in the house midway along the southern section of Sinnoh-Route-212.

In Platinum, trade to move tutors on Sinnoh-Route-212, in Snowpoint-City, and in the Survival-Area.  Eight shards total are required per tutelage, but the particular combination of colors varies by move.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a Cheri-Berry, a Leppa-Berry, and a Pecha-Berry with the Juggler near the Pokémon Center in Violet-City.

In HeartGold and SoulSilver, trade one for a Persim-Berry, a Pomeg-Berry, and a Razz-Berry with the Juggler near the Pal-Park entrance in Fuchsia-City.
red-shard.effect_short: No effect. Can be traded for items or moves.
red-shard.name: Red Shard

relic-band.description:
A heavy bracelet made by an ancient
civilization about 3,000 years ago.
relic-band.effect_short: Sell to Villa Owner for 100000 Pokédollars.
relic-band.name: Relic Band

relic-copper.description:
A copper coin used by an ancient
civilization about 3,000 years ago.
relic-copper.effect_short: Sell to Villa Owner for 1000 Pokédollars.
relic-copper.name: Relic Copper

relic-crown.description:
A heavy crown made by an ancient
civilization about 3,000 years ago.
relic-crown.effect_short: Sell to Villa Owner for 300000 Pokédollars.
relic-crown.name: Relic Crown

relic-gold.description:
A gold coin used by an ancient
civilization about 3,000 years ago.
relic-gold.name: Relic Gold

relic-silver.description:
A silver coin used by an ancient
civilization about 3,000 years ago.
relic-silver.name: Relic Silver

relic-statue.description:
A stone figurine made by an ancient
civilization about 3,000 years ago.
relic-statue.name: Relic Statue

relic-vase.description:
A fragile vase made by an ancient
civilization about 3,000 years ago.
relic-vase.name: Relic Vase

repeat-ball.description:
A somewhat different Poké Ball that
works especially well on a Pokémon
species that has been caught before.
repeat-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If the wild Pokémon's species is marked as caught in the trainer's Pokédex, this ball has a catch rate of 3×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
repeat-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon.  Success rate is 3× for previously-caught Pokémon.
repeat-ball.name: Repeat Ball

repel.description:
An item that prevents any low-level
wild Pokémon from jumping out at
you for 100 steps after its use.
repel.effect_long:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 100 steps.
repel.effect_short: For 100 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.
repel.name: Repel

reply-mail.description:
Stationery designed to make it easy
to respond to a letter you received.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
reply-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
reply-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
reply-mail.name: Reply Mail

reset-urge.description:
When used, it restores any stat
changes of an ally Pokémon.
reset-urge.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon in battle
:   Selects another friendly Pokémon at random.  Removes all of that Pokémon's stat changes.

This item can only be obtained or used via the Wonder Launcher.
reset-urge.effect_short: Resets a friendly Pokémon's stat changes.
reset-urge.name: Reset Urge

resist-wing.description:
An item for use on a Pokémon.
It slightly increases the base Defense
stat of a single Pokémon.
resist-wing.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Defense effort by 1.
resist-wing.name: Resist Wing

retro-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL featuring a print
of three cute POKéMON.
It is to be held by a POKéMON.
retro-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
retro-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
retro-mail.name: Retro Mail

reveal-glass.description:
A looking glass that reveals the truth.
It’s a mysterious glass that returns
a Pokémon to its original shape.
reveal-glass.effect_short: Switches Tornadus, Thundurus, and Landorus between Incarnate and Therian Forme.
reveal-glass.name: Reveal Glass

revival-herb.description:
A terribly bitter medicinal herb.
It revives a fainted Pokémon and
fully restores its maximum HP.
revival-herb.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Revives a fainted Pokémon and restores its HP to full.  Decreases happiness by 10/10/15.
revival-herb.effect_short: Revives with full HP, but lowers happiness.
revival-herb.name: Revival Herb

revive.description:
A medicine that can revive fainted
Pokémon. It also restores half of
a fainted Pokémon’s maximum HP.
revive.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Revives the Pokémon and restores half its HP.
revive.name: Revive

rich-mulch.description:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
It increases the Berry harvest without
the need for particularly diligent care.
rich-mulch.name: Rich Mulch

rindo-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Grass-type attack.
rindo-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Grass-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
rindo-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Grass-type attack to halve the damage.
rindo-berry.name: Rindo Berry

ring-target.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
Moves that normally have no effect
will land on a Pokémon holding it.
ring-target.effect_long:
Held
:   When one of the user's types would render it immune to damage, that type is ignored for damage calculation.
ring-target.effect_short: Held: Negates the holder's type immunities. Ability immunities are not removed.
ring-target.name: Ring Target

rm-1-key.description:
A key that opens the door to Room
1 inside the ABANDONED SHIP.
It is old and looks easily broken.
rm-1-key.effect_short: Unlocks room 1 on the Abandoned Ship.
rm-1-key.name: Rm. 1 Key

rm-2-key.description:
A key that opens the door to Room
2 inside the ABANDONED SHIP.
It is old and looks easily broken.
rm-2-key.effect_short: Unlocks room 2 on the Abandoned Ship.
rm-2-key.name: Rm. 2 Key

rm-4-key.description:
A key that opens the door to Room
4 inside the ABANDONED SHIP.
It is old and looks easily broken.
rm-4-key.effect_short: Unlocks room 4 on the Abandoned Ship.
rm-4-key.name: Rm. 4 Key

rm-6-key.description:
A key that opens the door to Room
6 inside the ABANDONED SHIP.
It is old and looks easily broken.
rm-6-key.effect_short: Unlocks room 6 on the Abandoned Ship.
rm-6-key.name: Rm. 6 Key

rock-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of rock.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Rock-type move one time.
rock-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Rock-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
rock-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Rock-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
rock-gem.name: Rock Gem

rock-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This exotic-smelling incense boosts
the power of Rock-type moves.
rock-incense.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Rock moves by 20%.
rock-incense.effect_short: Held: Rock-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Sudowoodo begets a Bonsly Egg.
rock-incense.name: Rock Incense

rocky-helmet.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
If the holder is hit, the attacker will
also be damaged upon contact.
rocky-helmet.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder is hit by a contact move, the attacking Pokémon takes 1/6 its max HP in damage.
rocky-helmet.effect_short: Held: When the holder is hit by a contact move, the attacking Pokémon takes 1/6 its max HP in damage.
rocky-helmet.name: Rocky Helmet

roller-skates.description:
Attaches roller skates to the bottom
of your shoes, allowing you to glide
quickly around and perform tricks.
roller-skates.name: Roller Skates

root-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived in the sea. It looks as
if it could be part of a plant’s root.
root-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in the Mining-Museum in Oreburgh-City or the Museum of Science in Pewter-City to receive a Lileep.
root-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into a Lileep.
root-fossil.name: Root Fossil

rose-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This exotic-smelling incense boosts
the power of Grass-type moves.
rose-incense.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Grass moves by 20%.
rose-incense.effect_short: Held: Grass-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Roselia or Roserade beget a Budew Egg.
rose-incense.name: Rose Incense

roseli-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Fairy-type attack.
roseli-berry.name: Roseli Berry

rowap-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a special attack hits the Pokémon
holding it, the attacker will also be hurt.
rowap-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder takes special damage, it consumes this item to damage the attacking Pokémon for 1/8 its max HP.
rowap-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed to deal 1/8 attacker's max HP when holder is struck by a special attack.
rowap-berry.name: Rowap Berry

rsvp-mail.description:
Stationery designed to allow you to
extend an invitation to the recipient.
Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
rsvp-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
rsvp-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
rsvp-mail.name: RSVP Mail

ruby.description:
An exquisitely beautiful gem that
has a red glow.
It symbolizes passion.
ruby.effect_long: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.
ruby.effect_short: Give to Celio with Sapphire to activate Network Machine and get Rainbow Pass.
ruby.name: Ruby

rule-book.description:
It lists the rules for holding battles.
For Link Battles, you may choose
which set of rules you wish to use.
rule-book.effect_short: List of battle types and their rules.
rule-book.name: Rule Book

sachet.description:
A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes
that are just slightly too overwhelming.
Yet it’s loved by a certain Pokémon.
sachet.name: Sachet

sacred-ash.description:
This rare ash can revive all fainted
Pokémon in a party. In doing so, it
also fully restores their maximum HP.
sacred-ash.effect_long:
Used
:   Revives all fainted Pokémon in the party and restores their HP to full.
sacred-ash.effect_short: Revives all fainted Pokémon with full HP.
sacred-ash.name: Sacred Ash

safari-ball.description:
A special Poké Ball that is used only in
the Great Marsh. It is recognizable by
the camouflage pattern decorating it.
safari-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5×.

This item can only be used in the Great-Marsh or Kanto-Safari-Zone.
safari-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon in the Great Marsh or Safari Zone.  Success rate is 1.5×.
safari-ball.name: Safari Ball

safety-goggles.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
These goggles protect the holder from
both weather-related damage and powder.
safety-goggles.name: Safety Goggles

sail-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived on the land. It looks
like the impression from a skin sail.
sail-fossil.name: Sail Fossil

salac-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, its Speed
stat will increase when it’s in a pinch.
salac-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise its Speed by one stage.
salac-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost Speed.
salac-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
salac-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
salac-berry.name: Salac Berry

sapphire.description:
An exquisitely beautiful gem that
has a blue glow.
It symbolizes honesty.
sapphire.effect_long: Deliver to Celio for use in the Network Machine.
sapphire.effect_short: Give to Celio with Ruby to activate Network Machine and get Rainbow Pass.
sapphire.name: Sapphire

scanner.description:
A device used to search for
life-forms in water.
It looks too difficult to use.
scanner.effect_long: May be traded to Captain Stern for a Deep-Sea-Tooth or a Deep-Sea-Scale.
scanner.effect_short: Trade to Captain Stern for a DeepSeaTooth or DeepSeaScale.
scanner.name: Scanner

scizorite.description:
One variety of the mysterious Mega Stones.
Have Scizor hold it, and this stone will
enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.
scizorite.name: Scizorite

scope-lens.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a lens for scoping out weak points.
It boosts the holder’s critical-hit ratio.
scope-lens.effect_long: Held: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 1.
scope-lens.effect_short: Held: Raises the holder's critical hit ratio by one stage.
scope-lens.name: Scope Lens

sea-incense.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This incense has a curious aroma that
boosts the power of Water-type moves.
sea-incense.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.
sea-incense.effect_short: Held: Water-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Breeding: Marill or Azumarill beget an Azurill Egg.
sea-incense.name: Sea Incense

seal-bag.description:
A tiny bag that can hold 10 Seals
for decorating Poké Balls.
seal-bag.effect_short: Holds ten Seals for Poké Balls.
seal-bag.name: Seal Bag

seal-case.description:
A case for storing Seals that can be
applied to the exteriors of Poké Balls.
seal-case.effect_long: Contains Seals used for decorating Pokéballs.
seal-case.effect_short: Stores Seals that can be applied to Poké Ball capsules.
seal-case.name: Seal Case

secret-key.description:
A high-tech key that has to be used at
a specific location. It emits a special
electronic signal to open a door.
secret-key.effect_long:
Used by trainer in the Galactic Eterna Building, on the ground floor, to the left of the TV
:   Unlocks the secret Rotom room, in which there are five appliances which can change Rotom's form.
secret-key.effect_short: Gen IV: The key to Rotom's appliance room. Gen III: The key to Cinnabar Gym.
secret-key.name: Secret Key

secret-potion.description:
A fantastic medicine dispensed by the
pharmacy in Cianwood City. It fully
heals a Pokémon of any ailment.
secret-potion.effect_long: Required to cure the Psyducks blocking Route 210 of their chronic headaches.
secret-potion.effect_short: Used to heal the Ampharos at the top of Olivine Lighthouse.
secret-potion.name: Secret Potion

shadow-mail.description:
A piece of MAIL featuring a cute
DUSKULL print.
It is to be held by a POKéMON.
shadow-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
shadow-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
shadow-mail.name: Shadow Mail

sharp-beak.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a long, sharp beak that boosts
the power of Flying-type moves.
sharp-beak.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Flying moves by 20%.
sharp-beak.effect_short: Held: Flying-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
sharp-beak.name: Sharp Beak

shed-shell.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
This discarded carapace enables the
holder to switch out of battle without fail.
shed-shell.effect_long: Held: The holder is unaffected by any moves or abilities that would prevent it from actively leaving battle.
shed-shell.effect_short: Held: Holder can bypass all trapping effects and switch out. Multi-turn moves still cannot be switched out of.
shed-shell.name: Shed Shell

shell-bell.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
The holder regains a little HP every
time it inflicts damage on others.
shell-bell.effect_long: Held: Heals the holder by 1/8 of any damage it inflicts.
shell-bell.effect_short: Held: Holder receives 1/8 of the damage it deals when attacking.
shell-bell.name: Shell Bell

shiny-charm.description:
A shiny charm said to increase
the chance of finding a Shiny
Pokémon in the wild.
shiny-charm.effect_short: Raises the chance of finding a shiny Pokémon.
shiny-charm.name: Shiny Charm

shiny-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It shines with a dazzling light.
shiny-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a Minccino into Cinccino, a Roselia into Roserade, or a Togetic into Togekiss.
shiny-stone.effect_short: Evolves a Minccino into Cinccino, a Roselia into Roserade, or a Togetic into Togekiss.
shiny-stone.name: Shiny Stone

shoal-salt.description:
Pure salt that can be discovered
only deep inside the Shoal Cave.
shoal-salt.effect_short: No effect. Gen III: Trade four and four Shoal Shells for a Shell Bell.
shoal-salt.name: Shoal Salt

shoal-shell.description:
A pretty seashell that can be
found deep inside the Shoal Cave.
shoal-shell.effect_short: No effect. Gen III: Trade four and four Shoal Salts for a Shell Bell.
shoal-shell.name: Shoal Shell

shock-drive.description:
A cassette to be held by Genesect.
It changes Genesect’s Techno Blast
move so it becomes Electric type.
shock-drive.effect_long:
Held by Genesect
:   Holder's buster is yellow, and its Techno-Blast is Electric-type.
shock-drive.effect_short: Grants Genesect a yellow, Electric-type Techno Blast.
shock-drive.name: Shock Drive

shuca-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Ground-type attack.
shuca-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Ground-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
shuca-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Ground-type attack to halve the damage.
shuca-berry.name: Shuca Berry

silk-scarf.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a sumptuous scarf that boosts
the power of Normal-type moves.
silk-scarf.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Normal moves by 20%.
silk-scarf.effect_short: Held: Normal-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
silk-scarf.name: Silk Scarf

silph-scope.description:
A scope that makes unseeable
POKéMON visible.
It is made by SILPH CO.
silph-scope.effect_short: Used to identify the true forms of ghosts in Pokémon Tower.
silph-scope.name: Silph Scope

silver-powder.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a shiny, silver powder that will
boost the power of Bug-type moves.
silver-powder.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   Holder's Bug-type moves have 1.2× their power.
silver-powder.effect_short: Held: Bug-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
silver-powder.name: Silver Powder

silver-wing.description:
A strange, silvery feather
that sparkles.
silver-wing.effect_long: Causes Lugia to appear in the Whirl-Islands.
silver-wing.effect_short: Summons Lugia to the Whirl Islands.
silver-wing.name: Silver Wing

sitrus-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its
own HP by a small amount during battle.
sitrus-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/4 its max HP.

Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 1/4 the Pokémon's max HP.
sitrus-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/2 max HP to recover 1/4 max HP.
sitrus-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
sitrus-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
sitrus-berry.name: Sitrus Berry

skull-fossil.description:
A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon
that once lived on the land. It appears
as though it’s part of a head.
skull-fossil.effect_long: Give to a scientist in the Mining-Museum in Oreburgh-City or the Museum of Science in Pewter-City to receive a Cranidos.
skull-fossil.effect_short: Can be revived into a Cranidos.
skull-fossil.name: Skull Fossil

sky-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Flying-type moves.
sky-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Flying moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Flying.
sky-plate.effect_short: Held: Flying-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Flying.
sky-plate.name: Sky Plate

slowpoke-tail.description:
A very tasty tail of something.
It can be sold at a high price to shops.
slowpoke-tail.effect_short: A tasty tail that sells for a high price.
slowpoke-tail.name: Slowpoke Tail

smoke-ball.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It enables the holder to flee from any
wild Pokémon encounter without fail.
smoke-ball.effect_long: Held: In wild battles, attempts to run away on the holder's turn will always succeed.
smoke-ball.effect_short: Held: Allows the Holder to escape from any wild battle.
smoke-ball.name: Smoke Ball

smooth-rock.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It extends the duration of the move
Sandstorm when used by the holder.
smooth-rock.effect_long: Held: The holder's Sandstorm will create a sandstorm lasting for eight turns rather than five.  As this item affects the move rather than the weather itself, the effect is not lost if the holder leaves battle or drops this item.
smooth-rock.effect_short: Held: Sandstorm by the holder lasts 8 rounds instead of 5.
smooth-rock.name: Smooth Rock

snow-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of a
chilly, snow-covered world.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
snow-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
snow-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
snow-mail.name: Snow Mail

snowball.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It boosts Attack if hit with an Ice-type
attack. It can only be used once.
snowball.name: Snowball

soda-pop.description:
A highly carbonated soda drink.
When consumed, it restores
60 HP to an injured Pokémon.
soda-pop.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 60 HP.
soda-pop.name: Soda Pop

soft-sand.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It is a loose, silky sand that boosts
the power of Ground-type moves.
soft-sand.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ground moves by 20%.
soft-sand.effect_short: Held: Ground-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
soft-sand.name: Soft Sand

soot-sack.description:
A sack used to collect volcanic
ash automatically during walks
over deep ash.
soot-sack.effect_long: Collects soot when walking through tall grass on Hoenn-Route-113.
soot-sack.name: Soot Sack

soothe-bell.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
The comforting chime of this bell
calms the holder, making it friendly.
soothe-bell.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder would earn happiness for any reason, it earns twice that amount instead.
soothe-bell.effect_short: Held: Doubles the happiness earned by the holder.
soothe-bell.name: Soothe Bell

soul-dew.description:
A wondrous orb to be held by either
Latios or Latias. It raises both the
Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.
soul-dew.effect_long: Held by Latias or Latios: Increases the holder's Special Attack and Special Defense by 50%.
soul-dew.effect_short: Raises Latias and Latios's Special Attack and Special Defense by 50%.
soul-dew.name: Soul Dew

space-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print depicting
the huge expanse of space.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
space-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
space-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
space-mail.name: Space Mail

spell-tag.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a sinister, eerie tag that boosts
the power of Ghost-type moves.
spell-tag.effect_long: Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ghost moves by 20%.
spell-tag.effect_short: Held: Ghost-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage.
spell-tag.name: Spell Tag

spelon-berry.description:
A Berry to be used in cooking.
This Berry is very rare and hard
to obtain in the Unova region.
spelon-berry.effect_long: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
spelon-berry.effect_short: Used for creating PokéBlocks and Poffins.
spelon-berry.name: Spelon Berry

splash-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Water-type moves.
splash-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Water moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Water.
splash-plate.effect_short: Held: Water-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Water.
splash-plate.name: Splash Plate

spooky-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Ghost-type moves.
spooky-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Ghost moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Ghost.
spooky-plate.effect_short: Held: Ghost-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Ghost.
spooky-plate.name: Spooky Plate

sport-ball.description:
A special Poké Ball that is used
during the Bug-Catching Contest.
sport-ball.effect_long:
Used by a trainer in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.

    The wild Pokémon's catch rate is 1.5× normal.
sport-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a Pokémon in the Bug-Catching contest in National Park. (Gen II: Park Ball)
sport-ball.name: Sport Ball

sprayduck.description:
A watering can shaped like a Psyduck.
It helps promote the healthy growth of
any Berries planted in good, soft soil.
sprayduck.name: Sprayduck

sprinklotad.description:
A watering can shaped like a Lotad.
It helps promote the healthy growth of
any Berries planted in good, soft soil.
sprinklotad.name: Sprinklotad

squirt-bottle.description:
A bottle used for watering plants in the
Berry Pots.
squirt-bottle.effect_long:
Required to water berries within the Berry-Pots.

Required to battle the Sudowoodo on Johto-Route-36.

This item cannot be directly used from the bag.
squirt-bottle.effect_short: Use on Sudowoodo blocking the path on Route 36. Also waters berries.
squirt-bottle.name: Squirt Bottle

ss-ticket.description:
A ticket required for sailing on the
ferry S.S. Aqua. It has a drawing
of a ship on its front.
ss-ticket.effect_long:
Allows passage on a ferry.

The same item is used for different ferries between different games.
ss-ticket.effect_short: Ticket for a ship. (RSE: S.S. Tidal LF: S.S. Anne HG: S.S. Aqua)
ss-ticket.name: S.S. Ticket

stable-mulch.description:
A fertilizer to be spread on soft soil
in regions where Berries are grown.
stable-mulch.effect_long:
Used on a patch of soil
:   Fully-grown plant will last 25% longer before dying and possibly regrowing.
stable-mulch.effect_short: Berries stay on the plant for longer than their usual time.
stable-mulch.name: Stable Mulch

star-piece.description:
A small shard of a beautiful gem that
demonstrates a distinctly red sparkle.
It can be sold at a high price to shops.
star-piece.effect_short: Platinum: Trade for one of each color Shard. Black and White: Trade for PP Up. Sell for 4900 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 9800 Pokédollars.
star-piece.name: Star Piece

stardust.description:
Lovely, red sand that flows between
the fingers with a loose, silky feel.
It can be sold at a high price to shops.
stardust.effect_short: Sell for 1000 Pokédollars, or to Ore Collector for 2000 Pokédollars.
stardust.name: Stardust

starf-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
If a Pokémon holds one, one of its stats
will sharply increase when it’s in a pinch.
starf-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder has 1/4 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to raise a random stat by two stages.
starf-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed at 1/4 max HP to boost a random stat by two stages.
starf-berry.fling_effect_long: Inflicts [regular damage]{mechanic:regular-damage}.  Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
starf-berry.fling_effect_short: Has a $effect_chance% chance to [poison]{mechanic:poison} the target.
starf-berry.name: Starf Berry

steel-gem.description:
A gem with an essence of steel.
When held, it strengthens the power
of a Steel-type move one time.
steel-gem.effect_long:
Held
:   When the holder uses a damaging Steel-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
steel-gem.effect_short: Held: When the holder uses a damaging Steel-type move, the move has 1.5× power and this item is consumed.
steel-gem.name: Steel Gem

steel-mail.description:
Stationery featuring a print of cool
mechanical designs.
Let a Pokémon hold it for delivery.
steel-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
steel-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
steel-mail.name: Steel Mail

stick.description:
An item to be held by Farfetch’d.
This very long and stiff stalk of
leek boosts its critical-hit ratio.
stick.effect_long: Held by Farfetch'd: Raises the holder's critical hit counter by 2.
stick.effect_short: Raises Farfetch'd's critical hit ratio by two stages.
stick.name: Stick

sticky-barb.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It damages the holder every turn and may
latch on to Pokémon that touch the holder.
sticky-barb.effect_long: Held: Damaged the holder for 1/8 its max HP.  When the holder is struck by a contact move, damages the attacker for 1/8 its max HP; if the attacker is not holding an item, it will take this item.
sticky-barb.effect_short: Held: Holder takes 1/8 (12.5%) its max HP at the end of each turn. When the holder is hit by a contact move, the attacking Pokémon takes 1/8 its max HP in damage and receive the item if not holding one.
sticky-barb.name: Sticky Barb

stone-plate.description:
An item to be held by a Pokémon.
It’s a stone tablet that boosts the
power of Rock-type moves.
stone-plate.effect_long:
Held: Increases the power of the holder's Rock moves by 20%.
Held by a Multitype Pokémon: Holder's type becomes Rock.
stone-plate.effect_short: Held: Rock-Type moves from holder do 20% more damage. Changes Arceus's and Judgment's type to Rock.
stone-plate.name: Stone Plate

storage-key.description:
The key to Team Galactic’s sinister
warehouse located at the edge of
Veilstone City.
storage-key.effect_long: Grants access to the Team Galactic warehouse in Veilstone City.
storage-key.effect_short: Grants access to the Team Galactic warehouse in Veilstone City.
storage-key.name: Storage Key

strange-souvenir.description:
An ornament depicting a Pokémon
that is venerated as a protector
in some region far from Kalos.
strange-souvenir.name: Strange Souvenir

suite-key.description:
A key to one of the suites at a certain
luxury hotel by a lake. For some odd
reason, it often disappears.
suite-key.effect_long: Opens the locked building in the lakeside resort.
suite-key.effect_short: Opens a locked building in the Lakeside Resort.
suite-key.name: Suite Key

sun-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It burns as red as the evening sun.
sun-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves a Cottonee into Whimsicott, a Gloom into Bellossom, a Petilil into Lilligant, or a Sunkern into Sunflora.
sun-stone.effect_short: Evolves a Cottonee into Whimsicott, a Gloom into Bellossom, a Petilil into Lilligant, or a Sunkern into Sunflora.
sun-stone.name: Sun Stone

super-potion.description:
A spray-type medicine for treating
wounds. It can be used to restore
50 HP to an injured Pokémon.
super-potion.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Restores 50 HP.
super-potion.name: Super Potion

super-repel.description:
An item that prevents any low-level
wild Pokémon from jumping out at
you for 200 steps after its use.
super-repel.effect_long:
Used outside of battle
:   Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon.  This effect wears off after the trainer takes 200 steps.
super-repel.effect_short: For 200 steps, prevents wild encounters of level lower than your party's lead Pokémon.
super-repel.name: Super Repel

super-rod.description:
An awesome, high-tech fishing rod.
Use it at any body of water to
fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.
super-rod.effect_long: Used to find Pokémon on the Super Rod list for an area, which are generally the best available there.
super-rod.effect_short: Used to catch Pokémon in bodies of water.
super-rod.name: Super Rod

surprise-mulch.description:
Mulch to be used in a Berry field.
It causes strange, sudden mutations
based on the combination of Berries.
surprise-mulch.name: Surprise Mulch

sweet-heart.description:
A piece of cloyingly sweet chocolate.
When consumed, it restores
20 HP to an injured Pokémon.
sweet-heart.effect_long:
Used on a friendly Pokémon
:   Restores 20 HP.
sweet-heart.name: Sweet Heart

swift-wing.description:
An item for use on a Pokémon.
It slightly increases the base Speed
stat of a single Pokémon.
swift-wing.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases the target's Speed effort by 1.
swift-wing.name: Swift Wing

tamato-berry.description:
A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon.
Using it on a Pokémon makes it more
friendly but lowers its base Speed.
tamato-berry.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Speed effort by 10.
tamato-berry.effect_short: Drops Speed Effort Values by 10 and raises happiness.
tamato-berry.name: Tamato Berry

tanga-berry.description:
If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will
lessen the damage taken from one
supereffective Bug-type attack.
tanga-berry.effect_long:
Held in battle
:   When the holder would take super-effective Bug-type damage, it consumes this item to halve the amount of damage taken.
tanga-berry.effect_short: Held: Consumed when struck by a super-effective Bug-type attack to halve the damage.
tanga-berry.name: Tanga Berry

tea.description:
An aromatic tea prepared by an old
lady. It will slake even the worst
thirst.
tea.effect_long: Used to bribe the Saffron-City guards for entry to the city.
tea.name: Tea

teachy-tv.description:
A television set that is tuned to
a program with useful tips for
novice TRAINERS.
teachy-tv.name: Teachy TV

thanks-mail.description:
Stationery designed to make it easy
for you to express thanks. Have a
Pokémon hold it for delivery.
thanks-mail.effect_long:
Used to send short messages to other players via Pokémon trading.  Trainer may compose a message from a finite list of words when giving this item to a Pokémon.  Once taken and read, a message may be erased and this item can be reused, or the message may be stored in the trainer's PC.

Held
:   Holder cannot be placed in the PC.  Any move attempting to remove this item from the holder will fail.
thanks-mail.effect_short: Lets a Trainer write a message and send it via Pokémon trade.
thanks-mail.name: Thanks Mail

thick-club.description:
An item to be held by Cubone or
Marowak. It is a hard bone of some
sort that boosts the Attack stat.
thick-club.effect_long: Held by Cubone or Marowak: Doubles the holder's Attack.
thick-club.name: Thick Club

thunder-stone.description:
A peculiar stone that can make
certain species of Pokémon evolve.
It has a distinct thunderbolt pattern.
thunder-stone.effect_long:
Used on a party Pokémon
:   Evolves an Eelektrik into Eelektross, an Eevee into Jolteon, or a Pikachu into Raichu.
thunder-stone.effect_short: Evolves an Eelektrik into Eelektross, an Eevee into Jolteon, or a Pikachu into Raichu.
thunder-stone.name: Thunder Stone

tidal-bell.description:
A very old-fashioned bell that
makes a gentle ringing sound.
tidal-bell.effect_long: May be given to the Kimono Girls to summon Lugia to the top of the Bell-Tower.
tidal-bell.name: Tidal Bell

timer-ball.description:
A somewhat different Poké Ball that
becomes progressively more effective
the more turns that are taken in battle.
timer-ball.effect_long:
Used in battle
:   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of 1.1× on the first turn of the battle and increases by 0.1× every turn, to a maximum of 4× on turn 30.

    If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
timer-ball.effect_short: Tries to catch a wild Pokémon. Success rate increases by 0.1× (Gen V: 0.3×) every turn, to a max of 4×.
timer-ball.name: Timer Ball

tiny-mushroom.description:
A very small and rare mushroom.
It’s popular with a certain class of
collectors and sought out by them.
tiny-mushroom.effect_short: Fire Red and Leaf Green: Trade two for prior Level-up moves. Sell for 250 Pokédollars, or to Hungry Maid for 500 Pokédollars.
tiny-mushroom.name: Tiny Mushroom

tm-case.description:
A case that holds TMs and HMs.
It is attached to the BAG’s
compartment for important items.
tm-case.name: TM Case

tm01.description:
The user sharpens its claws to
boost its Attack stat and accuracy.
tm01.effect_long: Teaches Focus Punch to a compatible Pokémon.
tm01.effect_short: Teaches Hone Claws to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Focus Punch Gen II: DynamicPunch Gen I: Mega Punch)
tm01.name: TM01

tm02.description:
The user slashes the target with huge,
sharp claws.
tm02.effect_long: Teaches Dragon Claw to a compatible Pokémon.
tm02.effect_short: Teaches Dragon Claw to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Headbutt Gen I: Razor Wind)
tm02.name: TM02

tm03.description:
The user materializes an odd
psychic wave to attack the target.
This attack does physical damage.
tm03.effect_long: Teaches Water Pulse to a compatible Pokémon.
tm03.effect_short: Teaches Psyshock to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Water Pulse Gen II: Curse Gen I: Swords Dance)
tm03.name: TM03

tm04.description:
The user quietly focuses its mind and
calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and
Sp. Def stats.
tm04.effect_long: Teaches Calm Mind to a compatible Pokémon.
tm04.effect_short: Teaches Calm Mind to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Rollout Gen I: Whirlwind)
tm04.name: TM04

tm05.description:
The target is scared off and a different
Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild,
this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
tm05.effect_long: Teaches Roar to a compatible Pokémon.
tm05.effect_short: Teaches Roar to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Mega Kick)
tm05.name: TM05

tm06.description:
A move that leaves the target
badly poisoned. Its poison
damage worsens every turn.
tm06.effect_long: Teaches Toxic to a compatible Pokémon.
tm06.effect_short: Teaches Toxic to a compatible Pokémon.
tm06.name: TM06

tm07.description:
The user summons a hailstorm lasting five
turns. It damages all Pokémon except the
Ice type.
tm07.effect_long: Teaches Hail to a compatible Pokémon.
tm07.effect_short: Teaches Hail to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Zap Cannon Gen I: Horn Drill)
tm07.name: TM07

tm08.description:
The user tenses its muscles to bulk up
its body, raising both its Attack and
Defense stats.
tm08.effect_long: Teaches Bulk Up to a compatible Pokémon.
tm08.effect_short: Teaches Bulk Up to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Rock Smash Gen I: Body Slam)
tm08.name: TM08

tm09.description:
The user drenches the target in a special
poisonous liquid. This move’s power is
doubled if the target is poisoned.
tm09.effect_long: Teaches Bullet Seed to a compatible Pokémon.
tm09.effect_short: Teaches Venoshock to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Bullet Seed Gen II: Psych Up Gen I: Take Down)
tm09.name: TM09

tm10.description:
A unique attack that varies in type
depending on the Pokémon using it.
tm10.effect_long: Teaches Hidden Power to a compatible Pokémon.
tm10.effect_short: Teaches Hidden Power to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Double-Edge)
tm10.name: TM10

tm100.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and
the target loses its ability to concentrate.
This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
tm100.name: TM100

tm11.description:
The user intensifies the sun
for five turns, powering up
Fire-type moves.
tm11.effect_long: Teaches Sunny Day to a compatible Pokémon.
tm11.effect_short: Teaches Sunny Day to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: BubbleBeam)
tm11.name: TM11

tm12.description:
The target is taunted into a rage
that allows it to use only attack
moves for three turns.
tm12.effect_long: Teaches Taunt to a compatible Pokémon.
tm12.effect_short: Teaches Taunt to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Sweet Scent Gen I: Water Gun)
tm12.name: TM12

tm13.description:
The target is struck with an icy-
cold beam of energy. This may
also leave the target frozen.
tm13.effect_long: Teaches Ice Beam to a compatible Pokémon.
tm13.effect_short: Teaches Ice Beam to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Snore)
tm13.name: TM13

tm14.description:
A howling blizzard is summoned to strike
opposing Pokémon. This may also leave
the opposing Pokémon frozen.
tm14.effect_long: Teaches Blizzard to a compatible Pokémon.
tm14.effect_short: Teaches Blizzard to a compatible Pokémon.
tm14.name: TM14

tm15.description:
The target is attacked with a powerful beam.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
tm15.effect_long: Teaches Hyper Beam to a compatible Pokémon.
tm15.effect_short: Teaches Hyper Beam to a compatible Pokémon.
tm15.name: TM15

tm16.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to
reduce damage from special attacks
for five turns.
tm16.effect_long: Teaches Light Screen to a compatible Pokémon.
tm16.effect_short: Teaches Light Screen to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Icy Wind Gen I: Pay Day)
tm16.name: TM16

tm17.description:
Enables the user to evade all attacks.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
tm17.effect_long: Teaches Protect to a compatible Pokémon.
tm17.effect_short: Teaches Protect to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Submission)
tm17.name: TM17

tm18.description:
The user summons a heavy rain
that falls for five turns, powering
up Water-type moves.
tm18.effect_long: Teaches Rain Dance to a compatible Pokémon.
tm18.effect_short: Teaches Rain Dance to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Counter)
tm18.name: TM18

tm19.description:
The user lands and rests its body.
It restores the user’s HP by up to
half of its max HP.
tm19.effect_long: Teaches Giga Drain to a compatible Pokémon.
tm19.effect_short: Teaches Telekinesis to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III & II: Giga Drain Gen I: Seismic Toss)
tm19.name: TM19

tm20.description:
The user creates a protective field
that prevents status conditions
for five turns.
tm20.effect_long: Teaches Safeguard to a compatible Pokémon.
tm20.effect_short: Teaches Safeguard to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Endure Gen I: Rage)
tm20.name: TM20

tm21.description:
A full-power attack that grows more
powerful the less the user likes
its Trainer.
tm21.effect_long: Teaches Frustration to a compatible Pokémon.
tm21.effect_short: Teaches Frustration to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Mega Drain)
tm21.name: TM21

tm22.description:
A two-turn attack. The user gathers
light, then blasts a bundled beam on
the next turn.
tm22.effect_long: Teaches SolarBeam to a compatible Pokémon.
tm22.effect_short: Teaches SolarBeam to a compatible Pokémon.
tm22.name: TM22

tm23.description:
The user throws a stone or similar projectile
to attack an opponent. A flying Pokémon
will fall to the ground when it’s hit.
tm23.effect_long: Teaches Iron Tail to a compatible Pokémon.
tm23.effect_short: Teaches Smack Down to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III & II: Iron Tail Gen I: Dragon Rage)
tm23.name: TM23

tm24.description:
A strong electric blast crashes down on
the target. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
tm24.effect_long: Teaches Thunderbolt to a compatible Pokémon.
tm24.effect_short: Teaches Thunderbolt to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: DragonBreath)
tm24.name: TM24

tm25.description:
A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on
the target to inflict damage. This may
also leave the target with paralysis.
tm25.effect_long: Teaches Thunder to a compatible Pokémon.
tm25.effect_short: Teaches Thunder to a compatible Pokémon.
tm25.name: TM25

tm26.description:
The user sets off an earthquake that
strikes every Pokémon around it.
tm26.effect_long: Teaches Earthquake to a compatible Pokémon.
tm26.effect_short: Teaches Earthquake to a compatible Pokémon.
tm26.name: TM26

tm27.description:
A full-power attack that grows more
powerful the more the user likes
its Trainer.
tm27.effect_long: Teaches Return to a compatible Pokémon.
tm27.effect_short: Teaches Return to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Fissure)
tm27.name: TM27

tm28.description:
The user burrows, then attacks
on the next turn. It can also
be used to exit dungeons.
tm28.effect_long: Teaches Dig to a compatible Pokémon.
tm28.effect_short: Teaches Dig to a compatible Pokémon.
tm28.name: TM28

tm29.description:
The target is hit by a strong telekinetic
force. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
tm29.effect_long: Teaches Psychic to a compatible Pokémon.
tm29.effect_short: Teaches Psychic to a compatible Pokémon.
tm29.name: TM29

tm30.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the
target. This may also lower the target’s
Sp. Def stat.
tm30.effect_long: Teaches Shadow Ball to a compatible Pokémon.
tm30.effect_short: Teaches Shadow Ball to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Teleport)
tm30.name: TM30

tm31.description:
The user attacks with a swift chop.
It can also break barriers, such as
Light Screen and Reflect.
tm31.effect_long: Teaches Brick Break to a compatible Pokémon.
tm31.effect_short: Teaches Brick Break to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Mud-Slap Gen I: Mimic)
tm31.name: TM31

tm32.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory
copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.
tm32.effect_long: Teaches Double Team to a compatible Pokémon.
tm32.effect_short: Teaches Double Team to a compatible Pokémon.
tm32.name: TM32

tm33.description:
A wondrous wall of light is put up to
reduce damage from physical attacks
for five turns.
tm33.effect_long: Teaches Reflect to a compatible Pokémon.
tm33.effect_short: Teaches Reflect to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Ice Punch)
tm33.name: TM33

tm34.description:
The user strikes everything around it by
swamping the area with a giant sludge wave.
This may also poison those hit.
tm34.effect_long: Teaches Shock Wave to a compatible Pokémon.
tm34.effect_short: Teaches Sludge Wave to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Shock Wave Gen II: Swagger Gen I: Bide)
tm34.name: TM34

tm35.description:
The target is scorched with an intense
blast of fire. This may also leave the
target with a burn.
tm35.effect_long: Teaches Flamethrower to a compatible Pokémon.
tm35.effect_short: Teaches Flamethrower to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Sleep Talk Gen I: Metronome)
tm35.name: TM35

tm36.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target.
This may also poison the target.
tm36.effect_long: Teaches Sludge Bomb to a compatible Pokémon.
tm36.effect_short: Teaches Sludge Bomb to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Selfdestruct)
tm36.name: TM36

tm37.description:
A five-turn sandstorm is summoned
to hurt all combatants except for
Rock, Ground, and Steel types.
tm37.effect_long: Teaches Sandstorm to a compatible Pokémon.
tm37.effect_short: Teaches Sandstorm to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Egg Bomb)
tm37.name: TM37

tm38.description:
The target is attacked with an intense
blast of all-consuming fire. This may
also leave the target with a burn.
tm38.effect_long: Teaches Fire Blast to a compatible Pokémon.
tm38.effect_short: Teaches Fire Blast to a compatible Pokémon.
tm38.name: TM38

tm39.description:
Boulders are hurled at the target.
This also lowers the target’s Speed
stat by preventing its movement.
tm39.effect_long: Teaches Rock Tomb to a compatible Pokémon.
tm39.effect_short: Teaches Rock Tomb to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II & I: Swift)
tm39.name: TM39

tm40.description:
The user confounds the target with
speed, then slashes.
This attack never misses.
tm40.effect_long: Teaches Aerial Ace to a compatible Pokémon.
tm40.effect_short: Teaches Aerial Ace to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Defense Curl Gen I: Skull Bash)
tm40.name: TM40

tm41.description:
The user torments and enrages the
target, making it incapable of using
the same move twice in a row.
tm41.effect_long: Teaches Torment to a compatible Pokémon.
tm41.effect_short: Teaches Torment to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: ThunderPunch Gen I: Softboiled)
tm41.name: TM41

tm42.description:
An attack move that doubles its power if
the user is poisoned, burned, or
has paralysis.
tm42.effect_long: Teaches Facade to a compatible Pokémon.
tm42.effect_short: Teaches Facade to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II & I: Dream Eater)
tm42.name: TM42

tm43.description:
Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks.
Then, building up more power,
the user raises its Speed stat.
tm43.effect_long: Teaches Secret Power to a compatible Pokémon.
tm43.effect_short: Teaches Flame Charge to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Secret Power Gen II: Detect Gen I: Sky Attack)
tm43.name: TM43

tm44.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns.
This fully restores the user’s HP and
heals any status conditions.
tm44.effect_long: Teaches Rest to a compatible Pokémon.
tm44.effect_short: Teaches Rest to a compatible Pokémon.
tm44.name: TM44

tm45.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user,
the target becomes infatuated and less
likely to attack.
tm45.effect_long: Teaches Attract to a compatible Pokémon.
tm45.effect_short: Teaches Attract to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Thunder Wave)
tm45.name: TM45

tm46.description:
The user attacks and steals the target’s
held item simultaneously. The user can’t
steal anything if it already holds an item.
tm46.effect_long: Teaches Thief to a compatible Pokémon.
tm46.effect_short: Teaches Thief to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen I: Psywave)
tm46.name: TM46

tm47.description:
The user makes a swift attack on
the target’s legs, which lowers the
target’s Speed stat.
tm47.effect_long: Teaches Steel Wing to a compatible Pokémon.
tm47.effect_short: Teaches Low Sweep to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III & II: Steel Wing Gen I: Explosion)
tm47.name: TM47

tm48.description:
The user attacks the target with a song.
Others can join in the Round and make
the attack do greater damage.
tm48.effect_long: Teaches Skill Swap to a compatible Pokémon.
tm48.effect_short: Teaches Round to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Skill Swap Gen II: Fire Punch Gen I: Rock Slide)
tm48.name: TM48

tm49.description:
The user attacks the target with an
echoing voice. If this move is used
every turn, it does greater damage.
tm49.effect_long: Teaches Snatch to a compatible Pokémon.
tm49.effect_short: Teaches Echoed Voice to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV & III: Snatch Gen II: Fury Cutter Gen I: Tri Attack)
tm49.name: TM49

tm50.description:
The user attacks the target at full power.
The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the
user’s Sp. Atk stat.
tm50.effect_long: Teaches Overheat to a compatible Pokémon.
tm50.effect_short: Teaches Overheat to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen II: Nightmare Gen I: Substitute)
tm50.name: TM50

tm51.description:
The target is hit with wings of steel.
This may also raise the user’s Defense stat.
tm51.effect_long: Teaches Roost to a compatible Pokémon.
tm51.effect_short: Teaches Ally Switch to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Roost)
tm51.name: TM51

tm52.description:
The user heightens its mental focus and
unleashes its power.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def.
tm52.effect_long: Teaches Focus Blast to a compatible Pokémon.
tm52.effect_short: Teaches Focus Blast to a compatible Pokémon.
tm52.name: TM52

tm53.description:
The user draws power from nature and
fires it at the target. This may also
lower the target’s Sp. Def.
tm53.effect_long: Teaches Energy Ball to a compatible Pokémon.
tm53.effect_short: Teaches Energy Ball to a compatible Pokémon.
tm53.name: TM53

tm54.description:
A restrained attack that prevents the
target from fainting. The target is left
with at least 1 HP.
tm54.effect_long: Teaches False Swipe to a compatible Pokémon.
tm54.effect_short: Teaches False Swipe to a compatible Pokémon.
tm54.name: TM54

tm55.description:
The user shoots boiling hot water at
its target. This may also leave the
target with a burn.
tm55.effect_long: Teaches Brine to a compatible Pokémon.
tm55.effect_short: Teaches Scald to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Brine)
tm55.name: TM55

tm56.description:
The user flings its held item at the target
to attack. This move’s power and effects
depend on the item.
tm56.effect_long: Teaches Fling to a compatible Pokémon.
tm56.effect_short: Teaches Fling to a compatible Pokémon.
tm56.name: TM56

tm57.description:
The user attacks with an electric
charge. The user may use any remaining
electricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.
tm57.effect_long: Teaches Charge Beam to a compatible Pokémon.
tm57.effect_short: Teaches Charge Beam to a compatible Pokémon.
tm57.name: TM57

tm58.description:
The user takes the target into the sky,
then drops it during the next turn.
The target cannot attack while in the sky.
tm58.effect_long: Teaches Endure to a compatible Pokémon.
tm58.effect_short: Teaches Sky Drop to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Endure)
tm58.name: TM58

tm59.description:
The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire.
If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a
Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
tm59.effect_long: Teaches Dragon Pulse to a compatible Pokémon.
tm59.effect_short: Teaches Incinerate to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Dragon Pulse)
tm59.name: TM59

tm60.description:
The user suppresses the target and
makes its move go last.
tm60.effect_long: Teaches Drain Punch to a compatible Pokémon.
tm60.effect_short: Teaches Quash to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Drain Punch)
tm60.name: TM60

tm61.description:
The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white
flame at the target to inflict a burn.
tm61.effect_long: Teaches Will-O-Wisp to a compatible Pokémon.
tm61.effect_short: Teaches Will-O-Wisp to a compatible Pokémon.
tm61.name: TM61

tm62.description:
The user nimbly strikes the target.
If the user is not holding an item,
this attack inflicts massive damage.
tm62.effect_long: Teaches Silver Wind to a compatible Pokémon.
tm62.effect_short: Teaches Acrobatics to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Silver Wind)
tm62.name: TM62

tm63.description:
This move prevents the target from
using its held item. Its Trainer is
also prevented from using items on it.
tm63.effect_long: Teaches Embargo to a compatible Pokémon.
tm63.effect_short: Teaches Embargo to a compatible Pokémon.
tm63.name: TM63

tm64.description:
The user attacks everything around it
by causing a tremendous explosion.
The user faints upon using this move.
tm64.effect_long: Teaches Explosion to a compatible Pokémon.
tm64.effect_short: Teaches Explosion to a compatible Pokémon.
tm64.name: TM64

tm65.description:
The user slashes with a sharp claw
made from shadows.
Critical hits land more easily.
tm65.effect_long: Teaches Shadow Claw to a compatible Pokémon.
tm65.effect_short: Teaches Shadow Claw to a compatible Pokémon.
tm65.name: TM65

tm66.description:
The user stores power, then attacks.
If the user moves after the target,
this attack’s power will be doubled.
tm66.effect_long: Teaches Payback to a compatible Pokémon.
tm66.effect_short: Teaches Payback to a compatible Pokémon.
tm66.name: TM66

tm67.description:
The user gets revenge for a fainted ally.
If an ally fainted in the previous turn,
this move becomes more powerful.
tm67.effect_long: Teaches Recycle to a compatible Pokémon.
tm67.effect_short: Teaches Retaliate to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Recycle)
tm67.name: TM67

tm68.description:
The user charges at the target using
every bit of its power.
The user can’t move on the next turn.
tm68.effect_long: Teaches Giga Impact to a compatible Pokémon.
tm68.effect_short: Teaches Giga Impact to a compatible Pokémon.
tm68.name: TM68

tm69.description:
The user polishes its body to reduce drag.
This can sharply raise the Speed stat.
tm69.effect_long: Teaches Rock Polish to a compatible Pokémon.
tm69.effect_short: Teaches Rock Polish to a compatible Pokémon.
tm69.name: TM69

tm70.description:
The user flashes a bright light that cuts
the target’s accuracy.
tm70.effect_long: Teaches Flash to a compatible Pokémon.
tm70.effect_short: Teaches Flash to a compatible Pokémon.
tm70.name: TM70

tm71.description:
The user stabs the target with
sharpened stones from below.
Critical hits land more easily.
tm71.effect_long: Teaches Stone Edge to a compatible Pokémon.
tm71.effect_short: Teaches Stone Edge to a compatible Pokémon.
tm71.name: TM71

tm72.description:
After making its attack, the user
rushes back to switch places with
a party Pokémon in waiting.
tm72.effect_long: Teaches Avalanche to a compatible Pokémon.
tm72.effect_short: Teaches Volt Switch to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Avalanche)
tm72.name: TM72

tm73.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of
electricity that paralyzes the target.
tm73.effect_long: Teaches Thunder Wave to a compatible Pokémon.
tm73.effect_short: Teaches Thunder Wave to a compatible Pokémon.
tm73.name: TM73

tm74.description:
The user tackles the target with a high-speed
spin. The slower the user compared to the
target, the greater the move’s power.
tm74.effect_long: Teaches Gyro Ball to a compatible Pokémon.
tm74.effect_short: Teaches Gyro Ball to a compatible Pokémon.
tm74.name: TM74

tm75.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting
spirit. This sharply raises the user’s
Attack stat.
tm75.effect_long: Teaches Swords Dance to a compatible Pokémon.
tm75.effect_short: Teaches Swords Dance to a compatible Pokémon.
tm75.name: TM75

tm76.description:
While resisting, the user attacks the
opposing Pokémon. This lowers the
Sp. Atk stat of those hit.
tm76.effect_long: Teaches Stealth Rock to a compatible Pokémon.
tm76.effect_short: Teaches Struggle Bug to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Stealth Rock)
tm76.name: TM76

tm77.description:
The user hypnotizes itself into
copying any stat change made
by the target.
tm77.effect_long: Teaches Psych Up to a compatible Pokémon.
tm77.effect_short: Teaches Psych Up to a compatible Pokémon.
tm77.name: TM77

tm78.description:
The user strikes everything around it
by stomping down on the ground.
This lowers the Speed stat of those hit.
tm78.effect_long: Teaches Captivate to a compatible Pokémon.
tm78.effect_short: Teaches Bulldoze to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Captivate)
tm78.name: TM78

tm79.description:
The user blows its cold breath on the
target. This attack always results in
a critical hit.
tm79.effect_long: Teaches Dark Pulse to a compatible Pokémon.
tm79.effect_short: Teaches Frost Breath to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Dark Pulse)
tm79.name: TM79

tm80.description:
Large boulders are hurled at the opposing
Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also
make the opposing Pokémon flinch.
tm80.effect_long: Teaches Rock Slide to a compatible Pokémon.
tm80.effect_short: Teaches Rock Slide to a compatible Pokémon.
tm80.name: TM80

tm81.description:
The user slashes at the target by
crossing its scythes or claws as if
they were a pair of scissors.
tm81.effect_long: Teaches X-Scissor to a compatible Pokémon.
tm81.effect_short: Teaches X-Scissor to a compatible Pokémon.
tm81.name: TM81

tm82.description:
The target is knocked away, and a different
Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this
ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
tm82.effect_long: Teaches Sleep Talk to a compatible Pokémon.
tm82.effect_short: Teaches Dragon Tail to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Sleep Talk)
tm82.name: TM82

tm83.description:
The target is infested and attacked
for four to five turns.
The target can’t flee during this time.
tm83.effect_long: Teaches Natural Gift to a compatible Pokémon.
tm83.effect_short: Teaches Work Up to a compatible Pokémon. (Gen IV: Natural Gift)
tm83.name: TM83

tm84.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle
or arm steeped in poison. This may also
poison the target.
tm84.effect_long: Teaches Poison Jab to a compatible Pokémon.
tm84.effect_short: Teaches Poison Jab to a compatible Pokémon.
tm84.name: TM84

tm85.description:
The user eats the dreams of a sleeping
target. It absorbs half the damage
caused to heal its own HP.
